<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />Adam, Seth, Enosh,

  <verse number="2" style="v" />Kenan, Mahalalel, Jared,

  <verse number="3" style="v" />Enoch, Methuselah, Lamech.

  <verse number="4" style="v" />The sons of Noah were Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

<note caller="+" style="f">

  <char style="ft">Some versions omit </char>

  <char style="fqa">The sons of ... </char>, but others include this expression. 

</note></para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="5" style="v" />The sons of Japheth were Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, and Tiras.

  <verse number="6" style="v" />The sons of Gomer were Ashkenaz, Riphath, and Togarmah.

<note caller="+" style="f">

  <char style="ft">Some versions have </char>

  <char style="fqa">Diphath </char>instead of 

  <char style="fqa">Riphath </char>. However, 

  <char style="fqa">Diphath </char>was probably a mispelling. Many ancient copies correct it to 

  <char style="fqa">Riphath </char>in order to make it agree with the same name in Gen. 10:2. 

</note>

  <verse number="7" style="v" />The sons of Javan were Elishah, Tarshish, Kittim, and Dodanim.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="8" style="v" />The sons of Ham were Cush, Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.

  <verse number="9" style="v" />The sons of Cush were Seba, Havilah, Sabta, Raamah, and Sabteca. The sons of Raamah were Sheba and Dedan.

  <verse number="10" style="v" />Cush became the father of Nimrod, who was the first conqueror on the earth.

<verse number="11" style="v" />Mizraim became the ancestor of the Ludites, Anamites, Lehabites, Naphtuhites,

  <verse number="12" style="v" />Pathrusites, Casluhites (from whom the Philistines came), and the Caphtorites.

<verse number="13" style="v" />Canaan became the father of Sidon, his firstborn, and of Heth.

  <verse number="14" style="v" />He also became the ancestor of the Jebusites, Amorites, Girgashites,

  <verse number="15" style="v" />Hivites, Arkites,  Sinites,

  <verse number="16" style="v" />Arvadites, Zemarites, and the Hamathites.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="17" style="v" />The sons of Shem were Elam, Asshur, Arpachshad, Lud, Aram, Uz, Hul, Gether, and Meshech.

  <verse number="18" style="v" />Arpachshad became the father of Shelah, and Shelah became the father of Eber.

  <verse number="19" style="v" />Eber had two sons. The name of the one was Peleg, for in his days the earth was divided. His brother's name was Joktan.

<verse number="20" style="v" />Joktan became the father of Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,

  <verse number="21" style="v" />Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,

  <verse number="22" style="v" />Obal, Abimael, Sheba,

  <verse number="23" style="v" />Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab; all these were descendants of Joktan.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="24" style="v" />Shem, Arpachshad, Shelah,

  <verse number="25" style="v" />Eber, Peleg, Reu,

  <verse number="26" style="v" />Serug, Nahor, Terah,

  <verse number="27" style="v" />Abram, who was Abraham.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="28" style="v" />The sons of Abraham were Isaac and Ishmael.

  <verse number="29" style="v" />These are their sons: the firstborn of Ishmael was Nebaioth, then Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam,

  <verse number="30" style="v" />Mishma, Dumah, Massa, Hadad, Tema,

  <verse number="31" style="v" />Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah. These were Ishmael's sons.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="32" style="v" />The sons of Keturah, Abraham's concubine, were Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, and Shuah.The sons of Jokshan were Sheba and Dedan.

  <verse number="33" style="v" />Midian's sons were Ephah, Epher, Hanoch, Abida, and Eldaah. All these were Keturah's descendants.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="34" style="v" />Abraham became the father of Isaac. The sons of Isaac were Esau and Israel.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="35" style="v" />The sons of Esau were Eliphaz, Reuel, Jeush, Jalam, and Korah.

  <verse number="36" style="v" />The sons of Eliphaz were Teman, Omar, Zepho, Gatam, Kenaz, Timna, and Amalek.

  <verse number="37" style="v" />The sons of Reuel were Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="38" style="v" />The sons of Seir were Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah, Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan.

  <verse number="39" style="v" />The sons of Lotan were Hori and Homam, and Timna was Lotan's sister.

  <verse number="40" style="v" />The sons of Shobal were Alvan, Manahath, Ebal, Shepho, and Onam. The sons of Zibeon were Aiah and Anah.

<verse number="41" style="v" />The son of Anah was Dishon. The sons of Dishon were Hamran, Eshban, Ithran, and Keran.

  <verse number="42" style="v" />The sons of Ezer were Bilhan, Zaavan, and Jaakan. The sons of Dishan were Uz and Aran.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="43" style="v" />These were the kings who reigned in the land of Edom before any king reigned over the Israelites: Bela son of Beor, and the name of his city was Dinhabah.

  <verse number="44" style="v" />When Bela died, Jobab son of Zerah of Bozrah reigned in his place.

  <verse number="45" style="v" />When Jobab died, Husham of the land of the Temanites reigned in his place.

<verse number="46" style="v" />When Husham died, Hadad son of Bedad, who defeated the Midianites in the land of Moab, reigned in his place. The name of his city was Avith.

  <verse number="47" style="v" />When Hadad died, Samlah of Masrekah reigned in his place.

  <verse number="48" style="v" />When Samlah died, Shaul of Rehoboth Hannahar reigned in his place.

<verse number="49" style="v" />When Shaul died, Baal Hanan son of Achbor reigned in his place.

  <verse number="50" style="v" />When Baal Hanan son of Achbor died, Hadar reigned in his place. The name of his city was Pai. His wife's name was Mehetabel daughter of Matred daughter of Me Zahab.

<verse number="51" style="v" />Hadad died.</para>

<para style="p">The heads of clans in Edom were Timna, Alvah, Jetheth,

  <verse number="52" style="v" />Oholibamah, Elah, Pinon,

  <verse number="53" style="v" />Kenaz, Teman, Mibzar,

  <verse number="54" style="v" />Magdiel, and Iram. These were the heads of clans in Edom.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />These were Israel's sons: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Zebulun,

  <verse number="2" style="v" />Dan, Joseph, Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="3" style="v" />Judah's sons were Er, Onan, and Shelah, who were born to him by Shua's daughter, the Canaanitess. Er, Judah's firstborn, was wicked in the sight of Yahweh, and Yahweh killed him.

  <verse number="4" style="v" />Tamar, his daughter-in-law, bore him Perez and Zerah. Judah had five sons.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="5" style="v" />Perez's sons were Hezron and Hamul.

  <verse number="6" style="v" />Zerah's sons were Zimri, Ethan, Heman, Calcol, and Dara, five in all.

  <verse number="7" style="v" />Carmi's son was Achar, who brought trouble on Israel when he stole what was reserved for God.

  <verse number="8" style="v" />Ethan's son was Azariah.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="9" style="v" />Hezron's sons were Jerahmeel, Ram, and Chelubai.

  <verse number="10" style="v" />Ram became the father of Amminadab, and Amminadab became the father of Nahshon, a leader among Judah's descendants.

  <verse number="11" style="v" />Nahshon became the father of Salma, and Salma became the father of Boaz.

  <verse number="12" style="v" />Boaz became the father of Obed, and Obed became the father of Jesse.

<verse number="13" style="v" />Jesse became the father of his firstborn Eliab, Abinadab the second, Shimea the third,

  <verse number="14" style="v" />Nethanel the fourth, Raddai the fifth,

  <verse number="15" style="v" />Ozem the sixth, and David the seventh.

<verse number="16" style="v" />Their sisters were Zeruiah and Abigail. The sons of Zeruiah were Abishai, Joab, and Asahel, three of them.

  <verse number="17" style="v" />Abigail bore Amasa, whose father was Jether the Ishmaelite.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="18" style="v" />Caleb son of Hezron became the father of children by Azubah, his wife, and by Jerioth. His sons were Jesher, Shobab, and Ardon.

  <verse number="19" style="v" />Azubah died, and then Caleb married Ephrath, who bore him Hur.

  <verse number="20" style="v" />Hur became the father of Uri, and Uri became the father of Bezalel.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="21" style="v" />Later Hezron (when he was sixty years old) married the daughter of Machir, the father of Gilead. She bore him Segub.

  <verse number="22" style="v" />Segub became the father of Jair, who controlled twenty-three cities in the land of Gilead.

<verse number="23" style="v" />Geshur and Aram took the towns of Jair and Kenath, as well as sixty surrounding towns. All these inhabitants were descendants of Machir, the father of Gilead.

  <verse number="24" style="v" />After the death of Hezron, Caleb slept with Ephrathah, the wife of his father Hezron. She bore him Ashhur, the father of Tekoa.

<note caller="+" style="f">

  <char style="ft">Some versions read, </char>

  <char style="fqa">After Hezron's death in Caleb Ephrathah, his wife Abijah bore him a son, Ashhur, the father of Tekoa. </char>

</note></para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="25" style="v" />The sons of Jerahmeel, the firstborn of Hezron, were Ram the firstborn, Bunah, Oren, Ozem, and Ahijah.

  <verse number="26" style="v" />Jerahmeel had another wife, whose name was Atarah. She was the mother of Onam.

  <verse number="27" style="v" />The sons of Ram, the firstborn of Jerahmeel, were Maaz, Jamin, and Eker.

  <verse number="28" style="v" />The sons of Onam were Shammai and Jada. The sons of Shammai were Nadab and Abishur.

<verse number="29" style="v" />The name of the wife of Abishur was Abihail, and she bore him Ahban and Molid.

  <verse number="30" style="v" />The sons of Nadab were Seled and Appaim, but Seled died without children.

  <verse number="31" style="v" />The son of Appaim was Ishi. The son of Ishi was Sheshan. The son of Sheshan was Ahlai.

  <verse number="32" style="v" />The sons of Jada, the brother of Shammai, were Jether and Jonathan. Jether died without children.

  <verse number="33" style="v" />The sons of Jonathan were Peleth and Zaza. These were the descendants of Jerahmeel.

<verse number="34" style="v" />Now Sheshan had no sons, only daughters. Sheshan had a servant, an Egyptian, whose name was Jarha.

  <verse number="35" style="v" />Sheshan gave his daughter to Jarha his servant as his wife. She bore him Attai.

<verse number="36" style="v" />Attai became the father of Nathan, and Nathan became the father of Zabad.

  <verse number="37" style="v" />Zabad became the father of Ephlal, and Ephlal became the father of Obed.

  <verse number="38" style="v" />Obed became the father of Jehu, and Jehu became the father of Azariah.

<verse number="39" style="v" />Azariah became the father of Helez, and Helez became the father of Eleasah.

  <verse number="40" style="v" />Eleasah became the father of Sismai, and Sismai became the father of Shallum.

  <verse number="41" style="v" />Shallum became the father of Jekamiah, and Jekamiah became the father of Elishama.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="42" style="v" />The sons of Caleb, the brother of Jerahmeel, were Mesha his firstborn, who was the father of Ziph. His second son, Mareshah, was the father of Hebron.

  <verse number="43" style="v" />The sons of Hebron were Korah, Tappuah, Rekem, and Shema.

  <verse number="44" style="v" />Shema became the father of Raham, the father of Jorkeam. Rekem became the father of Shammai.

<verse number="45" style="v" />The son of Shammai was Maon, and Maon was the father of Bethzur.

  <verse number="46" style="v" />Ephah, Caleb's concubine, bore Haran, Moza, and Gazez. Haran became the father of Gazez.

  <verse number="47" style="v" />The sons of Jahdai were Regem, Jotham, Geshan, Pelet, Ephah, and Shaaph.

<verse number="48" style="v" />Maacah, Caleb's concubine, bore Sheber and Tirhanah.

  <verse number="49" style="v" />She also bore Shaaph the father of Madmannah, Sheva the father of Machbena and the father of Gibea. The daughter of Caleb was Achsah. These were the descendants of Caleb.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="50" style="v" />These were the sons of Hur, his firstborn by Ephrathah: Shobal the father of Kiriath Jearim,
<verse number="51" style="v" />Salma the father of Bethlehem, and Hareph the father of Bethgader.

<verse number="52" style="v" />Shobal the father of Kiriath Jearim had descendants: Haroeh, half of the Menuthite people,

  <verse number="53" style="v" />and the clans of Kiriath Jearim: the Ithrites, Puthites, Shumathites, and Mishraites. The Zorathites and Eshtaolites descended from these.

<verse number="54" style="v" />The clans of Salma were the following: Bethlehem, the Netophathites, Atroth Beth Joab, and half of the Manahathites—the Zorites,

  <verse number="55" style="v" />the clans of the scribes who lived at Jabez: the Tirathites, Shimeathites, and Sucathites. These were the Kenites who descended from Hammath, the ancestor of the Rechabites.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />Now these are the sons of David who were born to him in Hebron: the firstborn was Amnon, by Ahinoam from Jezreel; the second was Daniel, by Abigail from Carmel;

  <verse number="2" style="v" />the third was Absalom, whose mother was Maacah, daughter of Talmai king of Geshur. The fourth was Adonijah son of Haggith;

  <verse number="3" style="v" />the fifth was Shephatiah by Abital; the sixth was Ithream by Eglah his wife.

<verse number="4" style="v" />These six were born to David in Hebron, where he reigned seven years and six months. He then ruled thirty-three years in Jerusalem.

  <verse number="5" style="v" />These four sons, by Bathshua daughter of Ammiel, were born to him in Jerusalem: Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, and Solomon.

<note caller="+" style="f">

  <char style="ft">Some versions have </char>

  <char style="fqa">Bathseba </char>instead of 

  <char style="fqa">Bathshua </char>. 

</note>

<verse number="6" style="v" />David's other nine sons were: Ibhar, Elishua, Elpelet,

<note caller="+" style="f">

  <char style="ft">ULB and UDB harmonize </char>

  <char style="fqa">Elishama </char>and 

  <char style="fqa">Eliphelet </char>to 

  <char style="fqa">Elishua </char>and 

  <char style="fqa">Elpelet </char>, as do some other versions. 

</note>

  <verse number="7" style="v" />Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia,

  <verse number="8" style="v" />Elishama, Eliada, and Eliphelet.

  <verse number="9" style="v" />These were David's sons, not including the sons by his concubines. Tamar was their sister.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="10" style="v" />Solomon's son was Rehoboam. Rehoboam's son was Abijah. Abijah's son was Asa. Asa's son was Jehoshaphat.

  <verse number="11" style="v" />Jehoshaphat's son was Joram. Joram's son was Ahaziah. Ahaziah's son was Joash.

  <verse number="12" style="v" />Joash's son was Amaziah. Amaziah's son was Azariah. Azariah's son was Jotham.

<verse number="13" style="v" />Jotham's son was Ahaz. Ahaz's son was Hezekiah. Hezekiah's son was Manasseh.

  <verse number="14" style="v" />Manasseh's son was Amon. Amon's son was Josiah.

<verse number="15" style="v" />Josiah's sons were his firstborn Johanan, his second son Jehoiakim, his third son Zedekiah, and his fourth son Shallum.

  <verse number="16" style="v" />Jehoiakim's sons were Jehoiachin and Zedekiah.

<verse number="17" style="v" />The sons of Jehoiachin, the captive, were Shealtiel,

  <verse number="18" style="v" />Malkiram, Pedaiah, Shenazzar, Jekamiah, Hoshama, and Nedabiah.

<verse number="19" style="v" />Pedaiah's sons were Zerubbabel and Shimei. Zerubbabel's sons were Meshullam and Hananiah; Shelomith was their sister.

  <verse number="20" style="v" />His other five sons were Hashubah, Ohel, Berechiah, Hasadiah, and Jushab Hesed.

  <verse number="21" style="v" />Hananiah's sons were Pelatiah and Jeshaiah. His son was Rephaiah, and further descendants were Arnan, Obadiah, and Shecaniah.

<verse number="22" style="v" />Shecaniah's son was Shemaiah. Shemaiah's sons were Hattush, Igal, Bariah, Neariah, and Shaphat.

  <verse number="23" style="v" />Neariah's three sons were Elioenai, Hizkiah, and Azrikam.

  <verse number="24" style="v" />Elioenai's seven sons were Hodaviah, Eliashib, Pelaiah, Akkub, Johanan, Delaiah, and Anani.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />Judah's descendants were Perez, Hezron, Carmi, Hur, and Shobal.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />Shobal was the father of Reaiah. Reaiah was the father of Jahath. Jahath was the father of Ahumai and Lahad. These were the ancestors of the clans of the Zorathites.

<verse number="3" style="v" />These were the ancestors of the clans in the city of Etam: Jezreel, Ishma, and Idbash. Their sister's name was Hazzelelponi.

  <verse number="4" style="v" />Penuel was the ancestor of the clans in the city of Gedor. Ezer was the originator of the clans in Hushah. These were descendants of Hur, the firstborn of Ephrathah and the originator of Bethlehem.

<verse number="5" style="v" />Ashhur the father of Tekoa had two wives, Helah and Naarah.

  <verse number="6" style="v" />Naarah bore him Ahuzzam, Hepher, Temeni, and Haahashtari. These were Naarah's sons.

  <verse number="7" style="v" />Helah's sons were Zereth, Izhar, Ethnan,

  <verse number="8" style="v" />and Koz, who became the father of Anub and Zobebah, and of the clans descended from Aharhel son of Harum.

<verse number="9" style="v" />Jabez was more respected than his brothers. His mother called him Jabez. She said, "Because I bore him in pain."

  <verse number="10" style="v" />Jabez called out to the God of Israel and said, "If only you would truly bless me, expand my territory, and your hand will be with me. When you do this you will keep me from harm, so that I may be free from pain!" So God granted him his prayer.

<verse number="11" style="v" />Kelub brother of Shuhah became the father of Mehir, who was the father of Eshton.

  <verse number="12" style="v" />Eshton became the father of Beth Rapha, Paseah, and Tehinnah, who began the city of Nahash. These were men who lived in Recah.

<verse number="13" style="v" />Kenaz's sons were Othniel and Seraiah. Othniel's sons were Hathath and Meonothai.

<note caller="+" style="f">

  <char style="ft">Most versions insert </char>

  <char style="fqa">Meonothai </char>into this verse, believing that it dropped out by a copyist's mistake. 

</note>

  <verse number="14" style="v" />Meonothai became the father of Ophrah, and Seraiah became the father of Joab, the originator of Ge Harashim, whose people were craftsmen.

  <verse number="15" style="v" />The sons of Caleb son of Jephunneh were Iru, Elah and Naam. Elah's son was Kenaz.

  <verse number="16" style="v" />Jehallelel's sons were Ziph, Ziphah, Tiria, and Asarel.

<verse number="17-18" style="v" />Ezrah's sons were Jether, Mered, Epher, and Jalon. Mered's Egyptian wife bore Miriam, Shammai, and Ishbah, who became the father of Eshtemoa. These were the sons of Bithiah, daughter of Pharaoh, whom Mered married. Mered's Jewish wife bore Jered, who became the father of Gedor; Heber, who became the father of Soco; and Jekuthiel, who became the father of Zanoah.

<verse number="19" style="v" />Of the two sons of Hodiah's wife, sister of Naham, one became the father of Keilah the Garmite. The other was Eshtemoa the Maacathite.

  <verse number="20" style="v" />The sons of Shimon were Amnon, Rinnah, Ben Hanan, and Tilon. The sons of Ishi were Zoheth and Ben Zoheth.

<verse number="21" style="v" />The descendants of Shelah son of Judah, were Er father of Lecah, Laadah father of Mareshah and the clans of the linen workers at Beth Ashbea,

  <verse number="22" style="v" />Jokim, the men of Cozeba, and Joash and Saraph, who had property in Moab, but who returned to Bethlehem. (This information is from ancient records.)

  <verse number="23" style="v" />Some of these people were the potters who lived in Netaim and Gederah and worked for the king.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="24" style="v" />Simeon's descendants were Nemuel, Jamin, Jarib, Zerah, and Shaul.

  <verse number="25" style="v" />Shallum was Shaul's son, Mibsam was Shallum's son, and Mishma was Mibsam's son.

  <verse number="26" style="v" />Mishma's descendants were Hammuel his son, Zaccur his grandson, and Shimei his great-grandson.

<verse number="27" style="v" />Shimei had sixteen sons and six daughters. His brothers did not have many children, so their clans did not increase greatly in numbers as the people of Judah did.

  <verse number="28" style="v" />They lived at Beersheba, Moladah, and at Hazar Shual.

<verse number="29" style="v" />They also live at Bilhah, Ezem, Tolad,

  <verse number="30" style="v" />Bethuel, Hormah, Ziklag,

  <verse number="31" style="v" />Beth Marcaboth, Hazar Susim, Beth Biri, and Shaaraim. These were their cities until the reign of David.

<verse number="32" style="v" />Their five villages were Etam, Ain, Rimmon, Tochen, and Ashan,

  <verse number="33" style="v" />together with the outlying villages as far as Baal. These were their settlements, and they kept the genealogical records.

<verse number="34" style="v" />Clan leaders were Meshobab, Jamlech, Joshah son of Amaziah,

  <verse number="35" style="v" />Joel, Jehu son of Joshibiah son of Seraiah son of Asiel,

  <verse number="36" style="v" />Elioenai, Jaakobah, Jeshohaiah, Asaiah, Adiel, Jesimiel, Benaiah,

  <verse number="37" style="v" />and Ziza son of Shiphi son of Allon son of Jedaiah son of Shimri son of Shemaiah.

  <verse number="38" style="v" />These mentioned by name were leaders in their clans, and their clans increased greatly.

<verse number="39" style="v" />They went near Gedor, on the east side of the valley, to seek pasture for their flocks.

  <verse number="40" style="v" />They found abundant and good pasture. The land was broad, quiet, and peaceable. The Hamites had formerly lived there.

  <verse number="41" style="v" />These just listed by name came in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah, and attacked the Hamite settlements and the Meunites, who were there also. They destroyed them completely and lived there because they found pasture for their flocks.

<verse number="42" style="v" />Five hundred men from the tribe of Simeon went to Mount Seir, with their leaders Pelatiah, Neariah, Rephaiah, and Uzziel, the sons of Ishi.

  <verse number="43" style="v" />They defeated the rest of the Amalekite refugees, and have lived there to this day.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />The sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel—now Reuben was Israel's firstborn, but his birthright was given to the sons of Joseph son of Israel because Reuben had defiled his father's couch. So he is not recorded as being the oldest son.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />Judah was the strongest of his brothers, and the leader would come from him. But the birthright was Joseph's—

  <verse number="3" style="v" />the sons of Reuben, the firstborn of Israel were Hanoch, Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi.

<verse number="4" style="v" />The descendants of Joel were these: Joel's son was Shemaiah. Shemaiah's son was Gog. Gog's son was Shimei.

  <verse number="5" style="v" />Shimei's son was Micah. Micah's son was Reaiah. Reaiah's son was Baal. 

  <verse number="6" style="v" />Baal's son was Beerah, whom Tilgath Pileser king of Assyria took into exile. Beerah was a leader in the tribe of Reuben.

<verse number="7" style="v" />Beerah's relatives by their clans are the following, listed in their genealogical records: Jeiel the oldest, Zechariah, and

  <verse number="8" style="v" />Bela son of Azaz son of Shema son of Joel. They lived in Aroer, as far as Nebo and Baal Meon,

  <verse number="9" style="v" />and eastward to the start of the wilderness that extends to the Euphrates River. This was because they had many cattle in the land of Gilead.
<verse number="10" style="v" />In the days of Saul, the tribe of Reuben attacked the Hagrites and defeated them. They lived in the Hagrites' tents throughout all the land east of Gilead.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="11" style="v" />The members of the tribe of Gad lived near them, in the land of Bashan as far as Salecah.

  <verse number="12" style="v" />Their leaders were Joel, who was a clan head, and Shapham was head of another clan, and Janai and Shaphat in Bashan.

  <verse number="13" style="v" />Their relatives, by their fathers' families, were Michael, Meshullam, Sheba, Jorai, Jacan, Zia, and Eber—seven in all.

<verse number="14" style="v" />These persons named above were the descendants of Abihail, and Abihail was the son of Huri. Huri was the son of Jaroah. Jaroah was the son of Gilead. Gilead was the son of Michael. Michael was the son of Jeshishai. Jeshishai was the son of Jahdo. Jahdo was the son of Buz.

  <verse number="15" style="v" />Ahi son of Abdiel son of Guni, was head of their fathers' family.

<verse number="16" style="v" />They lived in Gilead, in Bashan, in its towns, and in all the pasturelands of Sharon as far as its borders.

  <verse number="17" style="v" />All these were listed by genealogical records in the days of Jotham king of Judah and of Jeroboam king of Israel.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="18" style="v" />The Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half tribe of Manasseh had forty-four thousand soldiers trained for war, who carried shield and sword, and who drew the bow.

  <verse number="19" style="v" />They attacked the Hagrites, Jetur, Naphish, and Nodab.

<verse number="20" style="v" />They received divine help against them. In this way, the Hagrites and all who were with them were defeated. This was because the Israelites cried out to God in the battle, and he responded to them, because they put their trust in him.

  <verse number="21" style="v" />They captured their animals, including fifty thousand camels, 250,000 sheep, two thousand donkeys, and 100,000 men.

  <verse number="22" style="v" />Because God fought for them, they killed many of the enemy. They lived in their land until the captivity.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="23" style="v" />The half tribe of Manasseh lived in the land of Bashan as far as Baal Hermon and Senir (that is, Mount Hermon).

  <verse number="24" style="v" />These were the leaders of their families: Epher, Ishi, Eliel, Azriel, Jeremiah, Hodaviah, and Jahdiel. They were strong and courageous men, famous men, leaders of their families.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="25" style="v" />But they were unfaithful to their ancestors' God. Instead, they worshiped the gods of the peoples of the land, whom God had destroyed before them.

  <verse number="26" style="v" />The God of Israel stirred up Pul king of Assyria (also called Tilgath Pileser, king of Assyria). He took into exile the Reubenites, Gadites, and the half tribe of Manasseh. He took brought them to Halah, Habor, Hara, and to the river of Gozan, where they remain to this day.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />The sons of Levi were Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />The sons of Kohath were Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.

  <verse number="3" style="v" />The children of Amram were Aaron, Moses, and Miriam. The sons of Aaron were Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.

<verse number="4" style="v" />Eleazar became the father of Phinehas, and Phinehas became the father of Abishua.

  <verse number="5" style="v" />Abishua became the father of Bukki, and Bukki became the father of Uzzi.

  <verse number="6" style="v" />Uzzi became the father of Zerahiah, and Zerahiah became the father of Meraioth.

<verse number="7" style="v" />Meraioth became the father of Amariah, and Amariah became the father of Ahitub.

  <verse number="8" style="v" />Ahitub became the father of Zadok, and Zadok became the father of Ahimaaz.

  <verse number="9" style="v" />Ahimaaz became the father of Azariah, and Azariah became the father of Johanan.

<verse number="10" style="v" />Johanan became the father of Azariah, who served in the temple that Solomon built in Jerusalem.

  <verse number="11" style="v" />Azariah became the father of Amariah, and Amariah became the father of Ahitub.

  <verse number="12" style="v" />Ahitub became the father of Zadok, and Zadok became the father of Shallum.

<verse number="13" style="v" />Shallum became the father of Hilkiah, and Hilkiah became the father of Azariah.

  <verse number="14" style="v" />Azariah became the father of Seraiah, and Seraiah became the father of Jehozadak.

  <verse number="15" style="v" />Jehozadak went into captivity when Yahweh exiled Judah and Jerusalem by the hand of Nebuchadnezzar.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="16" style="v" />The sons of Levi were Gershom, Kohath, and Merari.

  <verse number="17" style="v" />The sons of Gershom were Libni and Shimei.

  <verse number="18" style="v" />The sons of Kohath were Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.

<verse number="19" style="v" />The sons of Merari were Mahli and Mushi. These became the Levites' clans by their fathers' families.

  <verse number="20" style="v" />Gershom's descendants began with his son Libni. Libni's son was Jahath. His son was Zimmah.

  <verse number="21" style="v" />His son was Joah. His son was Iddo. His son was Zerah. His son was Jeatherai.

<verse number="22" style="v" />Kohath's descendants began with his son Amminadab. His son was Korah. His son was Assir.

  <verse number="23" style="v" />His son was Elkanah. His son was Ebiasaph. His son was Assir.

  <verse number="24" style="v" />His son was Tahath. His son was Uriel. His son was Uzziah. His son was Shaul.

<verse number="25" style="v" />The sons of Elkanah were Amasai, Ahimoth, and Elkanah.

  <verse number="26" style="v" />The son of this second Elkanah was Zophai. His son was Nahath.

  <verse number="27" style="v" />His son was Eliab. His son was Jeroham. His son was Elkanah.

<verse number="28" style="v" />The sons of Samuel were the firstborn, Joel, and Abijah, the secondborn.

  <verse number="29" style="v" />The son of Merari was Mahli. His son was Libni. His son was Shimei. His son was Uzzah.

  <verse number="30" style="v" />His son was Shimea. His son was Haggiah. His son was Asaiah.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="31" style="v" />These are the names of the men whom David put in charge of music in the house of Yahweh, after the ark came to rest there.

  <verse number="32" style="v" />They served by singing before the tabernacle, the tent of meeting, until Solomon had built the house of Yahweh in Jerusalem. They fulfilled their duties according to the instructions given to them.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="33" style="v" />These were those who served with their sons. From the clans of the Kohathites came Heman the musician. Here were his ancestors, going back in time: Heman was the son of Joel. Joel was the son of Samuel.

  <verse number="34" style="v" />Samuel was the son of Elkanah. Elkanah was the son of Jeroham. Jeroham was the son of Eliel. Eliel was the son of Toa.

  <verse number="35" style="v" />Toa was the son of Zuph. Zuph was the son of Elkanah. Elkanah was the son of Mahath. Mahath was the son of Amasai. Amasai was son of Elkanah.

<verse number="36" style="v" />Elkanah was the son of Joel. Joel was the son of Azariah. Azariah was the son of Zephaniah.

  <verse number="37" style="v" />Zephaniah was the son of Tahath. Tahath was the son of Assir. Assir was the son of Ebiasaph. Ebiasaph was the son of Korah.

  <verse number="38" style="v" />Korah was the son of Izhar. Izhar was the son of Kohath. Kohath was the son of Levi. Levi was the son of Israel.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="39" style="v" />Heman's colleague was Asaph, who stood at his right hand. Asaph was the son of Berechiah. Berechiah was the son of Shimea. 

  <verse number="40" style="v" />Shimea was the son of Michael. Michael was the son of Baaseiah. Baaseiah was the son of Malchijah.

  <verse number="41" style="v" />Malchijah was the son of Ethni. Ethni was the son of Zerah. Zerah was the son of Adaiah.

  <verse number="42" style="v" />Adaiah was the son of Ethan. Ethan was the son of Zimmah. Zimmah was the son of Shimei.

  <verse number="43" style="v" />Shimei was the son of Jahath. Jahath was the son of Gershom. Gershom was the son of Levi.

<verse number="44" style="v" />At Heman's left hand were his colleagues the sons of Merari. They included Ethan son of Kishi. Kishi was the son of Abdi. Abdi was the son of Malluch.

  <verse number="45" style="v" />Malluch was the son of Hashabiah. Hashabiah was the son of Amaziah. Amaziah was the son of Hilkiah.

  <verse number="46" style="v" />Hilkiah was the son of Amzi. Amzi was the son of Bani. Bani was the son of Shemer.

  <verse number="47" style="v" />Shemer was the son of Mahli. Mahli was the son of Mushi. Mushi was the son of Merari. Merari was the son of Levi.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="48" style="v" />Their associates, the Levites, were assigned to do all the work for the tabernacle, the house of God.

<verse number="49" style="v" />Aaron and his sons made the offerings on the altar for burnt offerings; and the offering on the incense altar for all the work on the most holy place. These offerings made atonement for Israel, according to all that Moses the servant of God had commanded.

<verse number="50" style="v" />Aaron's descendants are reckoned as follows: Aaron's son was Eleazar. Eleazar's son was Phinehas. Phinehas's son was Abishua.

  <verse number="51" style="v" />Abishua's son was Bukki. Bukki's son was Uzzi. Uzzi's son was Zerahiah.

  <verse number="52" style="v" />Zerahiah's son was Meraioth. Meraioth's son was Amariah. Amariah's son was Ahitub.

  <verse number="53" style="v" />Ahitub's son was Zadok. Zadok's son was Ahimaaz.

<verse number="54" style="v" />These are the locations where Aaron's descendents were assigned to live, that is, for the descendants of Aaron who were from the clans of the Kohathites (the first lot was theirs).

  <verse number="55" style="v" />To them they gave Hebron in the land of Judah and its pasturelands,

  <verse number="56" style="v" />but the fields of the city and its villages they gave to Caleb son of Jephunneh.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="57" style="v" />To the descendants of Aaron they gave: Hebron (a city of refuge), and Libnah with its pasturelands, Jattir, Eshtemoa with its pasturelands,

  <verse number="58" style="v" />Hilen with its pasturelands, and Debir with its pasturelands.

<verse number="59" style="v" />They gave the descendants of Aaron: Ashan with its pasturelands and Beth Shemesh with its pasturelands;

  <verse number="60" style="v" />and from the tribe of Benjamin they were given Geba with its pasturelands, Alemeth with its pasturelands, and Anathoth with its pasturelands. All their cities numbered thirteen.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="61" style="v" />To the rest of Kohath's descendants they gave by lot ten cities from the half tribe of Manasseh.

  <verse number="62" style="v" />To Gershom's descendants in their various clans were given thirteen cities from the tribes of Issachar, Asher, Naphtali, and the half tribe of Manasseh in Bashan.

<verse number="63" style="v" />To Merari's descendants they gave twelve cities, according to their clans, from the tribes of Reuben, Gad, and Zebulun.

  <verse number="64" style="v" />So the people of Israel gave these cities with their pasturelands to the Levites.

  <verse number="65" style="v" />They assigned by lot the towns mentioned earlier from the tribes of Judah, Simeon, and Benjamin.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="66" style="v" />To some of the Kohathite clans they gave cities from the tribe of Ephraim.

  <verse number="67" style="v" />They gave them: Shechem (a city of refuge) with its pasturelands in the hill country of Ephraim, Gezer with its pasturelands,

  <verse number="68" style="v" />Jokmeam with its pasturelands, Beth Horon with its pasturelands,

  <verse number="69" style="v" />Aijalon with its pasturelands, and Gath Rimmon with its pasturelands.

<verse number="70" style="v" />The half tribe of Manasseh gave the Kohathites: Aner with its pasturelands and Bileam with its pasturelands. These became the possessions of the rest of the Kohathite clans.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="71" style="v" />To Gershom's descendants out of the clans of the half tribe of Manasseh, they gave: Golan in Bashan with its pasturelands and Ashtaroth with its pasturelands.

  <verse number="72" style="v" />The tribe of Issachar gave to Gershom's descendants: Kedesh with its pasturelands, Daberath with its pasturelands,

  <verse number="73" style="v" />Ramoth with its pasturelands, and Anem with its pasturelands.

<verse number="74" style="v" />Issachar received from the tribe of Asher: Mashal with its pasturelands, Abdon with its pasturelands,

  <verse number="75" style="v" />Hukok with its pasturelands, and Rehob with its pasturelands.

  <verse number="76" style="v" />They received from the tribe of Naphtali: Kedesh in Galilee with its pasturelands, Hammon with its pasturelands, and Kiriathaim with its pasturelands.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="77" style="v" />To the rest of the Levites, Merari's descendants, were given from the tribe of Zebulun: Rimmono with its pasturelands and Tabor with its pasturelands.

  <verse number="78-79" style="v" />To them were also given, on the other side of the Jordan at Jericho, on the river's east side: Bezer in the desert with its pasturelands, Jahzah with its pasturelands, Kedemoth with its pasturelands, and Mephaath with its pasturelands. These were given from the tribe of Reuben.

<verse number="80" style="v" />The Levites received fromo the tribe of Gad: Ramoth in Gilead with its pasturelands, Mahanaim with its pasturelands,

  <verse number="81" style="v" />Heshbon with its pasturelands, and Jazer with its pasturelands.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />Issachar's four sons were Tola, Puah, Jashub, and Shimron.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />The sons of Tola were Uzzi, Rephaiah, Jeriel, Jahmai, Ibsam, and Shemuel. They were the heads of their fathers' houses, from the descendants of Tola and they were listed as mighty warriors among their generation. They numbered 22,600 in the days of David.

  <verse number="3" style="v" />Uzzi's son was Izrahiah. His sons were Michael, Obadiah, Joel, and Isshiah, all five of them were clan leaders.

<verse number="4" style="v" />Along with them they had thirty-six thousand troops for battle, according to the lists belonging to their ancestors' clans, for they had many wives and sons.

  <verse number="5" style="v" />Their brothers, the tribe of Issachar, had eighty-seven thousand fighting men, according to the lists belonging to their ancestors' clans.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="6" style="v" />Benjamin's three sons were Bela, Becher, and Jediael.

  <verse number="7" style="v" />Bela's five sons were Ezbon, Uzzi, Uzziel, Jerimoth, and Iri. They were soldiers and originators of clans. Their people numbered 22,034 fighting men, according to the lists belonging to their ancestors' clans.

<verse number="8" style="v" />Becher's sons were Zemirah, Joash, Eliezer, Elioenai, Omri, Jeremoth, Abijah, Anathoth, and Alemeth. All these were his sons.

  <verse number="9" style="v" />The lists of their clans numbered 20,200 family leaders and fighting men.

  <verse number="10" style="v" />The son of Jediael was Bilhan. Bilhan's sons were Jeush, Benjamin, Ehud, Chenaanah, Zethan, Tarshish, and Ahishahar.

<verse number="11" style="v" />All these were sons of Jediael. Listed in their clan lists were 17,200 leaders and fighting men fit for military service.

  <verse number="12" style="v" />(Shuppim and Huppim were sons of Ir, and Hushim was a son of Aher.)</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="13" style="v" />Naphtali's sons were Jahziel, Guni, Jezer, and Shallum. These were Bilhah's grandsons.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="14" style="v" />Manasseh had a male child named Asriel, whom his Aramite concubine bore. She also gave birth to Machir, Gilead's father.

  <verse number="15" style="v" />Machir took a wife from the Huppites and Shuppites. A sister's name was Maacah. Another of Manasseh's descendants was Zelophehad, who had only daughters.

  <verse number="16" style="v" />Maacah wife of Machir, bore a son and she called him Peresh. His brother's name was Sheresh, and his sons were Ulam and Rakem.

<verse number="17" style="v" />Ulam's son was Bedan. These were the descendants of Gilead son of Machir son of Manasseh.

  <verse number="18" style="v" />Gilead's sister Hammolecheth bore Ishhod, Abi Ezer, and Mahlah.

  <verse number="19" style="v" />The sons of Shemida were Ahian, Shechem, Likhi, and Aniam.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="20" style="v" />The descendants of Ephraim were as follows: Ephraim's son was Shuthelah. Shuthelah's son was Bered. Bered's son was Tahath. Tahath's son was Eleadah. Eleadah's son was Tahath.

  <verse number="21" style="v" />Tahath's son was Zabad. Zabad's son was Shuthelah. (Ezer and Elead were killed by men of Gath, natives in the land, when they went to steal their cattle.

  <verse number="22" style="v" />Ephraim their father mourned for them many days, and his brothers came to comfort him.

<verse number="23" style="v" />He slept with his wife. She conceived and bore a son. Ephraim called him Beriah, because tragedy had come to his family.

  <verse number="24" style="v" />His daughter was Sheerah, who built Lower and Upper Beth Horon and Uzzen Sheerah.)

<verse number="25" style="v" />His son was Rephah. Rephah's son was Resheph. Resheph's son was Telah. Telah's son was Tahan.

  <verse number="26" style="v" />Tahan's son was Ladan. Ladan's son was Ammihud. Ammihud's son was Elishama.

  <verse number="27" style="v" />Elishama's son was Nun. Nun's son was Joshua.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="28" style="v" />Their possessions and residences were Bethel and its surrounding villages. They extended eastward to Naaran and westward to Gezer and its villages, and to Shechem and its villages to Ayyah and its villages.

  <verse number="29" style="v" />On the border with Manasseh were Beth Shan and its villages, Taanach and its villages, Megiddo and its villages, and Dor and its villages. In these towns the descendants of Joseph son of Israel lived.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="30" style="v" />Asher's sons were Imnah, Ishvah, Ishvi, and Beriah. Serah was their sister.

  <verse number="31" style="v" />Beriah's sons were Heber and Malchiel, who was the father of Birzaith.

  <verse number="32" style="v" />Heber's sons were Japhlet, Shomer, and Hotham. Shua was their sister.

<verse number="33" style="v" />Japhlet's sons were Pasach, Bimhal, and Ashvath. These were Japhlet's children.

  <verse number="34" style="v" />Shomer, Japhlet's brother, had these sons: Rohgah, Jehubbah, and Aram.

  <verse number="35" style="v" />Shemer's brother, Helem, had these sons: Zophah, Imna, Shelesh, and Amal.

<verse number="36" style="v" />Zophah's sons were Suah, Harnepher, Shual, Beri, Imrah,

  <verse number="37" style="v" />Bezer, Hod, Shamma, Shilshah, Ithran, and Beera.

  <verse number="38" style="v" />Jether's sons were Jephunneh, Pispa, and Ara.

<verse number="39" style="v" />Ulla's sons were Arah, Hanniel, and Rizia.

  <verse number="40" style="v" />All these were descendants of Asher. They were ancestors of the clans, leaders of their families, distinguished men, fighting men, and chief among the leaders. There were twenty-six thousand men listed who were fit for military service, according to their numbered lists.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />Benjamin's five sons were Bela his firstborn, Ashbel, Aharah,

  <verse number="2" style="v" />Nohah, and Rapha.

  <verse number="3" style="v" />Bela's sons were Addar, Gera, Abihud,

  <verse number="4" style="v" />Abishua, Naaman, Ahoah,

  <verse number="5" style="v" />Gera, Shephuphan, and Huram.

<verse number="6" style="v" />These were the descendants of Ehud who were heads of clans for the inhabitants of Geba, who were compelled to move to Manahath:

  <verse number="7" style="v" />Naaman, Ahijah, and Gera. The last, Gera, led them in their move. He was the father of Uzza and Ahihud.

<verse number="8" style="v" />Shaharaim became the father of children in the land of Moab, after he had divorced his wives Hushim and Baara.

  <verse number="9" style="v" />By his wife Hodesh, Shaharaim became the father of Jobab, Zibia, Mesha, Malcam,

  <verse number="10" style="v" />Jeuz, Shachia, and Mirmah. These were his sons, leaders in their clans.

  <verse number="11" style="v" />He had already become the father of Abitub and Elpaal by Hushim.

<verse number="12" style="v" />Elpaal's sons were Eber, Misham, and Shemed (who built Ono and Lod with its surrounding villages).

  <verse number="13" style="v" />There were also Beriah and Shema. They were heads of clans living in Aijalon, who drove out the inhabitants of Gath.

<verse number="14" style="v" />Beriah had these sons: Ahio, Shashak, Jeremoth,

  <verse number="15" style="v" />Zebadiah, Arad, Eder,

  <verse number="16" style="v" />Michael, Ishpah, and Joha.

  <verse number="17-18" style="v" />Elpaal had these sons: Zebadiah, Meshullam, Hizki, Heber, Ishmerai, Izliah, and Jobab.
<verse number="19-21" style="v" />Shimei had these sons: Jakim, Zichri, Zabdi, Elienai, Zillethai, Eliel, Adaiah, Beraiah, and Shimrath.
<verse number="22-25" style="v" />Shashak had these sons: Ishpan, Eber, Eliel, Abdon, Zichri, Hanan, Hananiah, Elam, Anthothijah, Iphdeiah, and Penuel.

<verse number="26-27" style="v" />Jeroham had these sons: Shamsherai, Shehariah, Athaliah, Jaareshiah, Elijah, and Zichri.

  <verse number="28" style="v" />These were heads of clans and leaders who lived in Jerusalem.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="29" style="v" />The father of Gibeon, Jeiel, whose wife's name was Maacah, lived in Gibeon.

  <verse number="30" style="v" />His firstborn was Abdon, followed by Zur, Kish, Baal, Nadab,

  <verse number="31" style="v" />Gedor, Ahio, and Zecher.

<verse number="32" style="v" />Another of Jeiel's sons was Mikloth, who became the father of Shimeah. They also lived near their relatives in Jerusalem.

  <verse number="33" style="v" />Ner was the father of Kish. Kish was the father of Saul. Saul was the father of Jonathan, Malchishua, Abinadab, and Ishbaal.

  <verse number="34" style="v" />The son of Jonathan was Merib Baal. Merib Baal was the father of Micah.

<verse number="35" style="v" />The sons of Micah were Pithon, Melech, Tarea, and Ahaz.

  <verse number="36" style="v" />Ahaz became the father of Jehoaddah. Jehoaddah was the father of Alemeth, Azmaveth, and Zimri. Zimri was the father of Moza.

  <verse number="37" style="v" />Moza was the father of Binea. Binea was the father of Raphah. Raphah was the father of Eleasah. Eleasah was the father of Azel.

<verse number="38" style="v" />Azel had six sons: Azrikam, Bocheru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah, and Hanan. All these were sons of Azel.

  <verse number="39" style="v" />The sons of Eshek, his brother, were Ulam his firstborn, Jeush the second, and Eliphelet the third.

  <verse number="40" style="v" />Ulam's sons were fighting men and archers. They had many sons and grandsons, a total of 150. All these belonged to the descendants of Benjamin.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />So all Israel was recorded in genealogies. They were recorded in the book of the kings of Israel. As for Judah, they were carried away in exile to Babylon because of their sin.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />The first to resettle in their cities were some Israelites, priests, Levites, and temple servants.

  <verse number="3" style="v" />Some descendants of Judah, Benjamin, Ephraim, and Manasseh lived in Jerusalem.

<verse number="4" style="v" />The settlers included Uthai son of Ammihud son of Omri son of Imri son of Bani, one of the descendants of Perez son of Judah.

  <verse number="5" style="v" />Among the Shilonites were Asaiah the firstborn and his sons.

  <verse number="6" style="v" />Among the descendants of Zerah was Jeuel. Their descendants numbered 690.

<verse number="7" style="v" />Among the descendants of Benjamin were Sallu son of Meshullam son of Hodaviah son of Hassenuah.

  <verse number="8" style="v" />There were also Ibneiah son of Jeroham; Elah son of Uzzi son of Michri; and Meshullam son of Shephatiah son of Reuel son of Ibnijah.

  <verse number="9" style="v" />Their relatives written in the genealogical lists numbered 956. All these men were leaders in their ancestors' clans.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="10" style="v" />The priests were Jedaiah, Jehoiarib, and Jachin.

  <verse number="11" style="v" />There was also Azariah son of Hilkiah son of Meshullam son of Zadok son of Meraioth son of Ahitub, the one in charge of the house of God.

<verse number="12" style="v" />There was Adaiah son of Jeroham son of Pashhur son of Malchijah. There was also Maasai son of Adiel son of Jahzerah son of Meshullam son of Meshillemith son of Immer.

  <verse number="13" style="v" />Their relatives, who were leaders in their ancestors' clans, numbered 1,760. They were very capable men in the work in the house of God.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="14" style="v" />Among the Levites, there was Shemaiah son of Hasshub son of Azrikam son of Hashabiah, among the descendants of Merari.

  <verse number="15" style="v" />There were also Bakbakkar, Heresh, Galal, and Mattaniah son of Mica son of Zichri son of Asaph.

  <verse number="16" style="v" />There were also Obadiah son of Shemaiah son of Galal son of Jeduthun; and Berechiah son of Asa son of Elkanah, who lived in the villages of the Netophathites.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="17" style="v" />The doorkeepers were Shallum, Akkub, Talmon, Ahiman, and their descendants. Shallum was their leader.

  <verse number="18" style="v" />Previously they stood guard at the king's gate on the east side for the camp of Levi's descendants.

  <verse number="19" style="v" />Shallum son of Kore son of Ebiasaph, who as son of Korah, and his relatives from the house of his father, the Korahites, were in charge of the work of the service, they guarded the door to the tent, as their ancestors had guarded the camp of Yahweh, and they also had guarded the entrance.

<verse number="20" style="v" />Phinehas son of Eleazar had been in charge of them in the past, and Yahweh had been with him.

  <verse number="21" style="v" />Zechariah son of Meshelemiah was guard of the entrance to the temple, the "tent of meeting."

<verse number="22" style="v" />All those who were chosen as gatekeepers at the entrances numbered 212. Their names were recorded in the people's records in their villages. David and Samuel the seer had placed them into their positions of trust.

  <verse number="23" style="v" />So they and their children guarded the gates of the house of Yahweh, the tabernacle.

  <verse number="24" style="v" />The gatekeepers were posted on all four sides, toward the east, west, north, and south.

<verse number="25" style="v" />Their brothers, who lived in their villages, came in for seven-day rotations, in turn.

  <verse number="26" style="v" />But the four leaders of the gatekeepers, who were Levites, were assigned to guard the rooms and storerooms in the house of God.

  <verse number="27" style="v" />They would spend the night in their posts all around the house of God, for they were responsible for guarding it. They would open it each morning.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="28" style="v" />Some of them were in charge of the temple's equipment; they counted the articles when they were brought in and when they were taken out.

  <verse number="29" style="v" />Some of them also were assigned to take care of the holy things, the equipment, and the supplies, including the fine flour, the wine, the oil, the frankincense, and the spices.

<verse number="30" style="v" />Some of the priests' sons mixed the spices.

  <verse number="31" style="v" />Mattithiah, one of the Levites, who was the firstborn of Shallum the Korahite, was in charge of preparing bread for the offerings.

  <verse number="32" style="v" />Some of their brothers, descendants of the Kohathites, were in charge of the bread of the presence, to prepare it every Sabbath.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="33" style="v" />The singers and Levite family leaders lived in rooms at the sanctuary when they were free from work, because they had to carry out their assigned tasks day and night.

  <verse number="34" style="v" />These were family leaders among the Levites, as listed in their genealogical records. They lived in Jerusalem.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="35" style="v" />The father of Gibeon, Jeiel, whose wife's name was Maacah, lived in Gibeon.

  <verse number="36" style="v" />His firstborn son was Abdon, then his sons Zur, Kish, Baal, Ner, Nadab,

  <verse number="37" style="v" />Gedor, Ahio, Zechariah, and Mikloth.

<verse number="38" style="v" />Mikloth was the father of Shimeam. They also lived near their brothers in Jerusalem.

  <verse number="39" style="v" />Ner was the father of Kish. Kish was the father of Saul. Saul was the father of Jonathan, Malchishua, Abinadab, and Ishbaal.

  <verse number="40" style="v" />The son of Jonathan was Merib Baal. Merib Baal was the father of Micah.

<verse number="41" style="v" />The sons of Micah were Pithon, Melech, Tahrea, andAhaz.

  <verse number="42" style="v" />Ahaz was the father of Jarah. Jarah was the father of Alemeth, Azmaveth, and Zimri. Zimri was the father of Moza.

  <verse number="43" style="v" />Moza was the father of Binea. Binea was the father of Rephaiah. Rephaiah was the father of Eleasah. Eleasah was the father of Azel.

  <verse number="44" style="v" />Azel's six sons were Azrikam, Bocheru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah, and Hanan. Thesewere Azel's sons.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />Now the Philistines fought against Israel. Every man of Israel fled from before the Philistines and fell down dead on Mount Gilboa.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />The Philistines closely pursued Saul and his son. The Philistines killed Jonathan, Abinadab, and Malchishua, his sons.

  <verse number="3" style="v" />The battle went heavily against Saul, and the archers overtook him. He was in severe pain because of the archers.

<verse number="4" style="v" />Then said Saul to his armor bearer, "Draw your sword and thrust me through with it. Otherwise, these uncircumcised will come and abuse me." But his armor bearer would not, for he was very afraid. So Saul took his own sword and fell on it.

<verse number="5" style="v" />When his armor bearer saw that Saul was dead, he likewise fell on his sword and died.

  <verse number="6" style="v" />So Saul died, and his three sons, so all his household members died together.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="7" style="v" />When every man of Israel in the valley saw that they had fled, and that Saul and his sons were dead, they abandoned their cities and fled. Then the Philistines came and lived in them.

  <verse number="8" style="v" />It came about on the next day, when the Philistines came to strip the dead, that they found Saul and his sons fallen on Mount Gilboa.

<verse number="9" style="v" />They stripped him and took his head and his armor. They sent messengers throughout Philistia to carry the news to their idols and to the people.

  <verse number="10" style="v" />They put his armor in the temple of their gods, and fastened his head to the temple of Dagon.

<verse number="11" style="v" />When all Jabesh Gilead heard of all that the Philistines had done to Saul,

  <verse number="12" style="v" />all the fighting men went and took away the body of Saul and those of his sons, and brought them to Jabesh. They buried their bones under the oak in Jabesh and fasted seven days.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="13" style="v" />So Saul died because he was unfaithful to Yahweh. He did not obey Yahweh's instructions, but asked for advice from someone who talked with the dead.

  <verse number="14" style="v" />He did not seek guidance from Yahweh, so Yahweh killed him and turned over the kingdom to David son of Jesse.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />Then all Israel came to David at Hebron and said, "Look, we are your flesh and bone.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />In the recent past, when Saul was king over us, it was you who led the Israelite army. Yahweh your God said to you, 'You will shepherd my people Israel, and you will become a ruler over my people Israel.'"

  <verse number="3" style="v" />So all the elders of Israel came to the king at Hebron, and David made a covenant with them before Yahweh. They anointed David king over Israel. In this way, the word of Yahweh that had been declared by Samuel came true.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="4" style="v" />David and all Israel went to Jerusalem (that is, Jebus). Now the Jebusites, the inhabitants of the land, were there.

  <verse number="5" style="v" />The inhabitants of Jebus said to David, "You will not come in here." But David took the stronghold of Zion, that is, the city of David.

  <verse number="6" style="v" />David had said, "Whoever attacks the Jebusites first will become a commander." So Joab son of Zeruiah attacked first, so he was made a commander.

<verse number="7" style="v" />Then David began to live in the stronghold. So they called it the city of David.

  <verse number="8" style="v" />He fortified the city around from the Millo and back to the surrounding wall. Joab fortified the rest of the city.

  <verse number="9" style="v" />David became greater and greater because Yahweh of hosts was with him.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="10" style="v" />These were the leaders David had, who showed themselves strong with him in his kingdom, together with all Israel, to make him king, obeying the word of Yahweh concerning Israel.

  <verse number="11" style="v" />This is a list of David's elite soldiers: Jashobeam, the son of a Hachmonite, was commander of the thirty. He killed three hundred men with his spear on one occasion.

<verse number="12" style="v" />After him was Eleazar son of Dodo, the Ahohite, who was one of the three mighty men.

  <verse number="13" style="v" />He was with David at Pasdammim, and there the Philistines assembled together for battle, where there was a barley field and the army fled from the Philistines.

  <verse number="14" style="v" />They stood in the middle of the field. They defended it and cut down the Philistines and Yahweh rescued them with a great victory.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="15" style="v" />Then three of the thirty leaders went down to the rock to David, to the cave of Adullam. The army of the Philistines was camped in the Valley of Rephaim.

  <verse number="16" style="v" />At that time David was in his stronghold, a cave, while the Philistines had established their camp at Bethlehem.

  <verse number="17" style="v" />David was longing for water and said, "If only someone would give me water to drink from the well at Bethlehem, the well that is by the gate!"

<verse number="18" style="v" />So these three mighty men broke through the army of the Philistines and drew water out of the well of Bethlehem, the well at the gate. They took the water and brought it to David, but he refused to drink it. Instead, he poured it out to Yahweh.

  <verse number="19" style="v" />Then he said, "Yahweh, far be it far from me, that I should drink this. Should I drink the blood of men who have risked their lives?" Because they had put their lives at risk, he refused to drink it. These are things the three mighty men did.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="20" style="v" />Abishai brother of Joab, was captain over the Three. He once used his spear against three hundred and killed them. He is mentioned along with the Three.

  <verse number="21" style="v" />Of the Three, he was given double honor and became their captain. Even though he was not one of them.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="22" style="v" />Benaiah son of Jehoiada was a strong man who did mighty feats. He killed the two sons of Ariel of Moab. He also went down into a pit and killed a lion while it was snowing.

  <verse number="23" style="v" />He even killed an Egyptian, a man five cubits tall. The Egyptian had a spear like a weaver's beam, but he went down to him with only a staff. He seized the spear out of the Egyptian's hand and killed him with his own spear.

<verse number="24" style="v" />Benaiah son of Jehoiada did these feats, and he was named alongside the three mighty men.

  <verse number="25" style="v" />He was more highly regarded than the thirty soldiers in general, but he was not regarded quite as highly as the three most elite soldiers. Yet David put him in charge of his bodyguard.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="26" style="v" />The mighty men were Asahel brother of Joab, Elhanan son of Dodo of Bethlehem,

  <verse number="27" style="v" />Shammoth the Harorite, Helez the Pelonite,

  <verse number="28" style="v" />Ira son of Ikkesh the Tekoite, Abi Ezer the Anathothite,

  <verse number="29" style="v" />Sibbecai the Hushathite, Ilai the Ahohite,

<verse number="30" style="v" />Maharai the Netophathite, Heled son of Baanah the Netophathite,

  <verse number="31" style="v" />Ittai son of Ribai of Gibeah of Benjamin's descendants, Benaiah the Pirathonite,

  <verse number="32" style="v" />Hurai of the valleys of Gaash, Abiel the Arbathite,

  <verse number="33" style="v" />Azmaveth the Baharumite, Eliahba the Shaalbonite,

<verse number="34" style="v" />the sons of Hashem the Gizonite, Jonathan son of Shagee the Hararite,

  <verse number="35" style="v" />Ahiam son of Sacar the Hararite, Eliphal son of Ur,

  <verse number="36" style="v" />Hepher the Mecherathite, Ahijah the Pelonite,

  <verse number="37" style="v" />Hezro the Carmelite, Naarai son of Ezbai,

<verse number="38" style="v" />Joel brother of Nathan, Mibhar son of Hagri,

  <verse number="39" style="v" />Zelek the Ammonite, Naharai the Berothite (the armor bearer of Joab son of Zeruiah),

  <verse number="40" style="v" />Ira the Ithrite, Gareb the Ithrite,

  <verse number="41" style="v" />Uriah the Hittite, Zabad son of Ahlai,

<verse number="42" style="v" />Adina son of Shiza the Reubenite (a chief of the Reubenites) and thirty with him,

  <verse number="43" style="v" />Hanan son of Maacah, and Joshaphat the Mithnite,

  <verse number="44" style="v" />Uzzia the Ashterathite, Shama and Jeiel sons of Hotham the Aroerite,

<verse number="45" style="v" />Jediael son of Shimri, Joha (his brother the Tizite),

  <verse number="46" style="v" />Eliel the Mahavite, Jeribai and Joshaviah sons of Elnaam, Ithmah the Moabite,

  <verse number="47" style="v" />Eliel, Obed, and Jaasiel the Mezobaite.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />These were the men who came to David to Ziklag, while he was still banished from the presence of Saul son of Kish. They were among the soldiers, his helpers in battle.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />They were armed with bows and could use both the right hand and the left in slinging stones and in shooting arrows from the bow. They were Benjamites, Saul's fellow tribesmen.

<verse number="3" style="v" />The chief was Ahi Ezer, then Joash, both sons of Shemaah the Gibeathite. There were Jeziel and Pelet, sons of Azmaveth. There were also Beracah, Jehu the Anathothite,

  <verse number="4" style="v" />Ishmaiah the Gibeonite, a soldier among the thirty (and in command of the thirty); Jeremiah, Jahaziel, Johanan, Jozabad the Gederathite,

<verse number="5" style="v" />Eluzai, Jerimoth, Bealiah, Shemariah, Shephatiah the Haruphite,

  <verse number="6" style="v" />the Korahites Elkanah, Isshiah, Azarel, Joezer, Jashobeam, and

  <verse number="7" style="v" />Joelah and Zebadiah, sons of Jeroham of Gedor.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="8" style="v" />Some Gadites joined David at the stronghold in the wilderness. They were fighting men, men trained for battle, who could handle shield and spear; whose faces were as fierce as the faces of lions. They were as swift as gazelles on the mountains.

<verse number="9" style="v" />There were Ezer the leader, Obadiah the second, Eliab the third,

  <verse number="10" style="v" />Mishmannah the fourth, Jeremiah the fifth,

  <verse number="11" style="v" />Attai the sixth, Eliel the seventh,

  <verse number="12" style="v" />Johanan the eighth, Elzabad the ninth,

  <verse number="13" style="v" />Jeremiah the tenth, Machbannai the eleventh.

<verse number="14" style="v" />These sons of Gad were leaders of the army. The least led a hundred, and the greatest led a thousand.

  <verse number="15" style="v" />They crossed the Jordan in the first month, when it overflowed its banks, and chased away all those living in the valleys, both toward the east and toward the west.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="16" style="v" />Some of the men of Benjamin and Judah came to the stronghold to David.

  <verse number="17" style="v" />David went out to meet them and addressed them: "If you have come in peace to me to help me, you may join me. But if you have come to betray me to my adversaries, may the God of our ancestors see and rebuke you, since I have done no wrong."

<verse number="18" style="v" />Then the Spirit came on Amasai, who was chief of the thirty. Amasai said, "We are yours, David. We are on your side, son of Jesse. Peace, may peace be to whoever helps you. May peace be to your helpers, for your God is helping you." Then David received them and made them commanders over his men.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="19" style="v" />Some from Manasseh also deserted to David when he came with the Philistines against Saul to battle. Yet they did not help the Philistines, because the Philistine lords consulted with each other and sent David away. They said, "He will desert to his master Saul at the risk of our lives."

  <verse number="20" style="v" />When he went to Ziklag, the men of Manasseh who joined him were Adnah, Jozabad, Jediael, Michael, Jozabad, Elihu, and Zillethai, captains over thousands of Manasseh.

<verse number="21" style="v" />They helped David fight against the roving bands, for they were fighting men. Later they became commanders in the army.

  <verse number="22" style="v" />Day after day, men came to David to help him, until there was a great army, like the army of God.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="23" style="v" />This is the record of the armed soldiers for war, who came to David to Hebron, to turn the kingdom of Saul over to him, which carried out Yahweh's word.

  <verse number="24" style="v" />From Judah those who carried shield and spear were 6,800, armed for war.

  <verse number="25" style="v" />From the Simeonites there were 7,100 fighting men.

<verse number="26" style="v" />From the Levites there were 4,600 fighting men.

  <verse number="27" style="v" />Jehoiada was the leader of Aaron's descendants, and with him were 3,700.

  <verse number="28" style="v" />With Zadok, a young, strong, and courageous man, were twenty-two leaders from his father's family.

<verse number="29" style="v" />From Benjamin, Saul's tribe, were three thousand. Most of them had remained loyal to Saul until this time.

  <verse number="30" style="v" />From the Ephraimites there were 20,800 fighting men, men famous in their fathers' families.

  <verse number="31" style="v" />From the half tribe of Manasseh there were eighteen thousand famous men who came to make David king.

<verse number="32" style="v" />From Issachar, there were two hundred leaders who had understanding of the times and knew what Israel ought to do. All their relatives were under their command.

  <verse number="33" style="v" />From Zebulun there were fifty thousand fighting men, prepared for battle, with all the weapons of war, and ready to give undivided loyalty.

<verse number="34" style="v" />From Naphtali there were one thousand officers, and with them thirty-seven thousand men with shields and spears.

  <verse number="35" style="v" />From the Danites there were 28,600 men prepared for battle.

<verse number="36" style="v" />From Asher there were forty thousand men prepared for battle.

  <verse number="37" style="v" />From the other side of the Jordan, from the Reubenites, Gadites, and the half tribe of Manasseh, there were 120,000 men armed with all kinds of weapons for battle.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="38" style="v" />All these soldiers, equipped for battle, came to Hebron with firm intentions to make David king over all Israel. All the rest of Israel were in agreement to make David king also.

  <verse number="39" style="v" />They were there with David three days, eating and drinking, for their relatives had sent them with provisions.

  <verse number="40" style="v" />In addition, those who were near to them, as far as Issachar and Zebulun and Naphtali, brought bread on donkeys, camels, mules, and oxen, and cakes of figs, clusters of raisins, wine, oil, oxen, and sheep, for Israel was celebrating.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />David consulted with the commanders of thousands and of hundreds, with every leader.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />David said to all the assembly of Israel, "If it seems good to you, and if this comes from Yahweh our God, let us send messengers everywhere to our brothers who remain in all the regions of Israel, and to the priests and Levites who are in their cities. Let them be told to join us.

  <verse number="3" style="v" />Let us bring the ark of our God back to ourselves, for we did not seek his will in the days of Saul's reign."

  <verse number="4" style="v" />The whole assembly agreed to do these things, because they seemed right in the eyes of all the people.

<verse number="5" style="v" />So David assembled all Israel together, from the Shihor River in Egypt to Lebo Hamath, to bring the ark of God from Kiriath Jearim.

  <verse number="6" style="v" />David and all Israel went up to Baalah, that is, Kiriath Jearim, which belongs to Judah, to bring up from there the ark of God, which is called by Yahweh's name, Yahweh, who sits enthroned over the cherubim.

<verse number="7" style="v" />So they set the ark of God on a new cart. They brought it out of Abinadab's house. Uzza and Ahio were guiding the cart.

  <verse number="8" style="v" />David and all Israel were celebrating before God with all their might. They were singing with stringed instruments, tambourines, cymbals, and trumpets.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="9" style="v" />When they came to the threshing floor of Kidon, Uzzah reached out with his hand to grab the ark, because the oxen stumbled.

  <verse number="10" style="v" />Then the anger of Yahweh burned against Uzzah, and Yahweh killed him because Uzzah had reached out with his hand to the ark. He died there before God.

  <verse number="11" style="v" />David was angry because Yahweh had attacked Uzzah. That place is called Perez Uzzah to this day.

<verse number="12" style="v" />David was afraid of God that day. He said, "How can I bring the ark of God home to me?"

  <verse number="13" style="v" />So David did not move the ark to the city of David, but put it aside in the house of Obed Edom the Gittite.

  <verse number="14" style="v" />The ark of God remained in Obed Edom's household in his house for three months. So Yahweh blessed his house and all that he possessed.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />Then Hiram king of Tyre sent messengers to David, and cedar trees, carpenters, and masons. They built a house for him.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />David knew that Yahweh had established him as king over Israel, and that his kingdom was exalted on high for the sake of his people Israel.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="3" style="v" />In Jerusalem, David took more wives, and he became the father of more sons and daughters.

  <verse number="4" style="v" />These were the names of the children who were born to him in Jerusalem: Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, Solomon,

  <verse number="5" style="v" />Ibhar, Elishama, Elpelet,

  <verse number="6" style="v" />Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia,

  <verse number="7" style="v" />Elishama, Beeliada, and Eliphelet.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="8" style="v" />Now when the Philistines heard that David had been anointed as king over all Israel, they all went out looking for him. But David heard about it and went out against them.

  <verse number="9" style="v" />Now the Philistines had come and made a raid in the Valley of Rephaim.

<verse number="10" style="v" />Then David asked for help from God. He said, "Should I attack the Philistines? Will you give victory over them?" Yahweh said to him, "Attack, for I will certainly give them to you."

  <verse number="11" style="v" />So they came up to Baal Perazim, and there he defeated them. He commented, "Yahweh has burst through my enemies by my hand like a bursting flood of water." So the name of that place became Baal Perazim.

  <verse number="12" style="v" />The Philistines abandoned their gods there, and David gave an order that they should be burned.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="13" style="v" />Then the Philistines raided the valley yet again.

  <verse number="14" style="v" />So David asked for help from God again. God said to him, "You must not attack their front, but rather circle around behind them and come on them through the balsam woods.

<verse number="15" style="v" />When you hear the sound of marching in the wind blowing through the balsam treetops, then attack with force. Do this because God will have gone out before you to attack the army of the Philistines."

  <verse number="16" style="v" />So David did as God had commanded him. He defeated the army of the Philistines from Gibeon all the way to Gezer.

  <verse number="17" style="v" />Then David's fame went out into all lands, and Yahweh caused all nations to fear him.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />David built houses for himself in the city of David. He prepared a place for the ark of God and set up a tent for it.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />Then David said, "Only the Levites may carry the ark of God, for they had been chosen by Yahweh to carry the ark of Yahweh, and to serve him forever."

  <verse number="3" style="v" />Then David assembled all Israel at Jerusalem, to bring up the ark of Yahweh to the place he had prepared for it.

<verse number="4" style="v" />David gathered together Aaron's descendants and the Levites.

  <verse number="5" style="v" />From the descendants of Kohath, there was Uriel the leader and his relatives, 120 men.

  <verse number="6" style="v" />From the descendants of Merari, there was Asaiah the leader and his relatives, 220 men.

<verse number="7" style="v" />From the descendants of Gershom, there was Joel the leader and his relatives, 130 men.

  <verse number="8" style="v" />From the descendants of Elizaphan, there was Shemaiah the leader and his relatives, 200 men.

  <verse number="9" style="v" />From the descendants of Hebron, there was Eliel the leader and his relatives, eighty men.

  <verse number="10" style="v" />From the descendants of Uzziel, there was Amminadab the leader and his relatives, 112 men.

<verse number="11" style="v" />David called for Zadok and Abiathar the priests, and the Levites Uriel, Asaiah, Joel, Shemaiah, Eliel, and Amminadab.

  <verse number="12" style="v" />He said to them, "You are the leaders of the Levite families. Consecrate yourselves, both you and your brothers, so that you may bring up the ark of Yahweh, the God of Israel, to the place that I have prepared for it.

<verse number="13" style="v" />You did not carry it the first time. That is why Yahweh our God broke out against us, for we did not seek him or obey his decree."

  <verse number="14" style="v" />So the priests and the Levites consecrated themselves so they could bring up the ark of Yahweh, the God of Israel.

  <verse number="15" style="v" />So the Levites carried the ark of God on their shoulders with the poles, as Moses had commanded—following the rules given by the word of Yahweh.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="16" style="v" />David spoke to the leaders of the Levites to assign their brothers to be musicians with musical instruments, stringed instruments, harps and cymbals, playing loudly and joyfully lifting up their voices.

  <verse number="17" style="v" />So the Levites appointed Heman son of Joel and one of his brothers, Asaph son of Berechiah. They also appointed kinsmen from Merari's descendants and Ethan son of Kushaiah.

  <verse number="18" style="v" />With them were their kinsmen of second rank: Zechariah, 

<note caller="+" style="f">

  <char style="ft">Some ancient copies add the name or prefix, "ben," assuming perhaps the name of Zechariah's father was omitted. </char>

</note>Jaaziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Benaiah, Maaseiah, Mattithiah, Eliphelehu, Mikneiah, Obed Edom, and Jeiel, the gatekeepers.

<verse number="19" style="v" />The musicians Heman, Asaph, and Ethan were appointed to play loud bronze cymbals.

  <verse number="20" style="v" />Zechariah, Aziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Maaseiah, and Benaiah played the stringed instruments, set to Alamoth.

  <verse number="21" style="v" />Mattithiah, Eliphelehu, Mikneiah, Obed Edom, Jeiel, and Azaziah led the way with harps set to the Sheminith.

<verse number="22" style="v" />Kenaniah, leader of the Levites, he was the director of the singing because he was a teacher of music.

  <verse number="23" style="v" />Berechiah and Elkanah were guards for the ark.

  <verse number="24" style="v" />Shebaniah, Joshaphat, Nethanel, Amasai, Zechariah, Benaiah, and Eliezer, the priests, were to blow the trumpets before the ark of God. Obed Edom and Jehiah were guards for the ark.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="25" style="v" />So David, the elders of Israel, and the commanders over thousands went to bring up the ark of the covenant of Yahweh out of Obed Edom's house with rejoicing.

  <verse number="26" style="v" />While God helped the Levites who carried the ark of the covenant of Yahweh, they sacrificed seven bulls and seven rams.

<verse number="27" style="v" />David was clothed with a robe of fine linen, as were the Levites who carried the ark, the singers, and Kenaniah, the leader of the song with the singers. David was wearing a linen ephod.

  <verse number="28" style="v" />So all Israel brought up the ark of the covenant of Yahweh with joyful shouting, and with the sound of horns, with cymbals, and with stringed instruments and harps.</para>

<para style="p">
