  <verse number="29" style="v" />But as the ark of the covenant of Yahweh came to the city of David, Michal daughter of Saul, looked out the window. She saw King David dancing and celebrating. Then she despised him in her heart.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />They brought in the ark of God and put it in the middle of the tent that David had set up for it. Then they offered burnt offerings and fellowship offerings before God.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />When David had finished sacrificing the burnt offering and the fellowship offerings, he blessed the people in the name of Yahweh.

  <verse number="3" style="v" />He distributed to every Israelite, both to men and women, a loaf of bread, and a piece of meat, and a cake of raisins.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="4" style="v" />David appointed certain Levites to serve before the ark of Yahweh, and to celebrate, thank and praise Yahweh, the God of Israel.

  <verse number="5" style="v" />These Levites were Asaph the leader, and second to him Zechariah, Jeiel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Mattithiah, Eliab, Benaiah, Obed Edom, and Jeiel. These were to play with stringed instruments and with harps. Asaph was to sound the cymbals, sounding loudly.

  <verse number="6" style="v" />Benaiah and Jahaziel the priests were to blow the horns regularly, before the ark of the covenant of God.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="7" style="v" />Then on that day David first appointed Asaph and his brothers to sing this song of thanksgiving to Yahweh.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="8" style="v" />Give thanks to Yahweh, call on his name;</para>

<para style="q1">make known his deeds among the nations.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="9" style="v" />Sing to him, sing praises to him;</para>

<para style="q1">speak of all his marvelous deeds.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="10" style="v" />Boast in his holy name;</para>

<para style="q1">let the heart of those who seek Yahweh rejoice.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="11" style="v" />Seek Yahweh and his strength;</para>

<para style="q1">seek his presence continually.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="12" style="v" />Recall the marvelous things he has done,</para>

<para style="q1">his miracles and the decrees from his mouth,</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="13" style="v" />you descendants of Israel his servant,</para>

<para style="q1">you people of Jacob, his chosen ones.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="14" style="v" />He is Yahweh, our God.</para>

<para style="q1">His decrees are on all the earth.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="15" style="v" />Keep his covenant in mind forever,</para>

<para style="q1">the word that he commanded for a thousand generations.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="16" style="v" />He calls to mind the covenant that he made with Abraham,</para>

<para style="q1">and his oath to Isaac.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="17" style="v" />This is what he confirmed to Jacob as a statute,</para>

<para style="q1">and to Israel as an everlasting covenant.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="18" style="v" />He said, "I will give you the land of Canaan</para>

<para style="q1">as your share of your inheritance."</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="19" style="v" />I said this when you were only few in number,</para>

<para style="q1">so very few, and were strangers in the land.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="20" style="v" />They went from nation to nation,</para>

<para style="q1">from one kingdom to another.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="21" style="v" />He did not allow anyone to oppress them;</para>

<para style="q1">he punished kings for their sakes.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="22" style="v" />he said, "Do not touch my anointed ones,</para>

<para style="q1">and do not harm my prophets."</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="23" style="v" />Sing to Yahweh, all the earth;</para>

<para style="q1">announce his salvation day after day.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="24" style="v" />Declare his glory among the nations,</para>

<para style="q1">his marvelous deeds among all the nations.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="25" style="v" />For Yahweh is great and is to be praised greatly,</para>

<para style="q1">and he is to be feared above all other gods.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="26" style="v" />For all the gods of the nations are idols,</para>

<para style="q1">but it is Yahweh who made the heavens.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="27" style="v" />Splendor and majesty are in his presence.</para>

<para style="q1">Strength and joy are in his place.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="28" style="v" />Ascribe to Yahweh, you clans of peoples,</para>

<para style="q1">ascribe to Yahweh glory and strength;</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="29" style="v" />Ascribe to Yahweh the glory due to his name.</para>

<para style="q1">Bring an offering and come before him.</para>

<para style="q1">Bow down to Yahweh in his holy splendor.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="30" style="v" />Tremble before him, all the earth.</para>

<para style="q1">The world also is established; it cannot be shaken.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="31" style="v" />Let the heavens be glad, and let the earth rejoice;</para>

<para style="q1">let them say among the nations, "Yahweh reigns."</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="32" style="v" />Let the sea roar, and that which fills it shout with joy.</para>

<para style="q1">Let the fields be joyful, and all that is in them.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="33" style="v" />Then let the trees in the forest shout for joy before Yahweh,</para>

<para style="q1">for he is coming to judge the earth.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="34" style="v" />Give thanks to Yahweh, for he is good,</para>

<para style="q1">for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="35" style="v" />Then say, "Save us, God of our salvation.</para>

<para style="q1">Gather us together and rescue us from the other nations,</para>

<para style="q1">so that we may give thanks to your holy name</para>

<para style="q1">and glory in your praises."</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="36" style="v" />May Yahweh, the God of Israel, be praised</para>

<para style="q1">from everlasting to everlasting.All the people said, "Amen" and praised Yahweh.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="37" style="v" />So David left Asaph and his brothers there before the ark of the covenant of Yahweh, to serve continually before the ark, as every day's work required.

  <verse number="38" style="v" />Obed Edom with those sixty-eight relatives were included. Obed Edom son of Jeduthun, along with Hosah, were to be gatekeepers.

  <verse number="39" style="v" />Zadok the priest and his fellow priests were to serve before the tabernacle of Yahweh at the high place in Gibeon.

<verse number="40" style="v" />They were to offer burnt offerings to Yahweh on the altar for burnt offerings continually morning and evening, according to all that is written in the law of Yahweh, which he gave as a command to Israel.

  <verse number="41" style="v" />Heman and Jeduthun were with them, together with the rest who were chosen by name, to give thanks to Yahweh, because his covenant faithfulness endures forever.

<verse number="42" style="v" />Heman and Jeduthun were in charge of those who played trumpets, cymbals, and the other instruments for the sacred music. The sons of Jeduthun guarded the gate.

  <verse number="43" style="v" />Then all the people returned to their homes, and David returned to bless his own household.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />It happened that after the king had settled in his house, he said to Nathan the prophet, "Look, I am living in a house of cedar, but the ark of the covenant of Yahweh is staying under a tent."

  <verse number="2" style="v" />Then Nathan said to David, "Go, do what is in your heart, for God is with you."

<verse number="3" style="v" />But that same night the word of God came to Nathan, saying,

  <verse number="4" style="v" />"Go and tell David my servant, 'This is what Yahweh says: You will not build me a house in which to live.

  <verse number="5" style="v" />For I have not lived in a house from the day that I brought up Israel to this present day. Instead, I have been living in a tent, a tabernacle, in various places.

  <verse number="6" style="v" />In all places I have moved among all Israel, did I ever say anything to any of Israel's leaders whom I appointed to shepherd my people, saying, "Why have you not built me a house of cedar?"'"

<verse number="7" style="v" />"Now then, tell my servant David, 'This is what Yahweh of hosts says: I took you from the pasture, from following the sheep, so that you would be ruler over my people Israel.

  <verse number="8" style="v" />I have been with you wherever you went and have cut off all your enemies from before you, and I will make you a name, like the name of the great ones who are on the earth.

<verse number="9" style="v" />I will appoint a place for my people Israel and will plant them there, so that they may live in their own place and be troubled no more. No longer will wicked people oppress them, as they did before,

  <verse number="10" style="v" />as they were doing from the days that I commanded judges to be over my people Israel. Then I will subdue all your enemies. Moreover I tell you that I, Yahweh, will build you a house.

<verse number="11" style="v" />It will come about that when your days are fulfilled for you to go to your fathers, I will raise up your descendant after you, and for one of your own descendants, I will establish his kingdom.

  <verse number="12" style="v" />He will build me a house, and I will establish his throne forever.

<verse number="13" style="v" />I will be a father to him, and he will be my son. I will not take my covenant faithfulness away from him, as I took it from Saul, who ruled before you.

  <verse number="14" style="v" />I will set him over my house and in my kingdom forever, and his throne will be established forever.'"

  <verse number="15" style="v" />Nathan spoke to David and reported to him all these words, and he told him about the entire vision.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="16" style="v" />Then David the king went in and sat before Yahweh; he said, "Who am I, Yahweh God, and what is my family, that you have brought me to this point?

  <verse number="17" style="v" />For this was a small thing in your sight, God. You have spoken of your servant's family for a great while to come, and have shown me future generations, Yahweh God.

  <verse number="18" style="v" />What more can I, David, say to you? You have honored your servant. You have given your servant special recognition.

<verse number="19" style="v" />Yahweh, for your servant's sake, and to fulfill your own purpose, you have done this great thing to reveal all your great deeds.

  <verse number="20" style="v" />Yahweh, there is none like you, and there is no God besides you, just as we have always heard.

  <verse number="21" style="v" />For what nation on earth is like your people Israel, whom you, God, rescued from Egypt as a people for yourself, to make a name for yourself by great and awesome deeds? You drove out nations from before your people, whom you rescued from Egypt.

<verse number="22" style="v" />You made Israel your own people forever, and you, Yahweh, became their God.

  <verse number="23" style="v" />So now, Yahweh, may the promise that you made concerning your servant and his family be established forever. Do as you have spoken.

  <verse number="24" style="v" />May your name be established forever and be great, so the people will say, 'Yahweh of hosts is the God of Israel,' while the house of me, David, your servant is established before you.

<verse number="25" style="v" />For you, my God, have revealed to your servant that you will build him a house. That is why I, your servant, have found courage to pray to you.

  <verse number="26" style="v" />Now, Yahweh, you are God, and have made this good promise to your servant:

  <verse number="27" style="v" />Now it has pleased you to bless your servant's house, that it may continue forever before you. You, Yahweh, have blessed it, and it will be blessed forever."</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />After this it came about that David attacked the Philistines and defeated them. He took Gath and its villages out of the Philistines' control.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />Then he defeated Moab, and the Moabites became servants to David and paid him tribute.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="3" style="v" />David then defeated Hadadezer, king of Zobah at Hamath, as Hadadezer was traveling to establish his rule by the Euphrates River.

  <verse number="4" style="v" />David captured from him a thousand chariots, seven thousand horsemen, and twenty thousand footmen. David hamstrung all the chariot horses, but reserved enough of them for a hundred chariots.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="5" style="v" />When the Arameans of Damascus came to help Hadadezer king of Zobah, David killed twenty-two thousand Aramean men.

  <verse number="6" style="v" />Then David put garrisons in Aram of Damascus, and the Arameans became servants to him and brought him tribute. Yahweh gave victory to David wherever he went.

<verse number="7" style="v" />David took the golden shields that were on Hadadezer's servants and brought them to Jerusalem.

  <verse number="8" style="v" />From Tibhath and Cun, cities of Hadadezer, David took very much bronze. It was with this bronze that Solomon later made the bronze sea, the pillars, and the bronze equipment.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="9" style="v" />When Toi, king of Hamath, heard that David had defeated all the army of Hadadezer king of Zobah,

  <verse number="10" style="v" />Toi sent Hadoram his son to King David to greet him and to bless him, because David had fought against Hadadezer and defeated him, and because Hadadezer had waged war against Toi. Hadoram brought with himself objects of silver, gold, and bronze.

  <verse number="11" style="v" />King David set these objects apart to Yahweh, together with the silver and the gold that he carried away from all the nations: Edom, Moab, the people of Ammon, the Philistines, and Amalek.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="12" style="v" />Abishai son of Zeruiah killed eighteen thousand Edomites in the Valley of Salt.

  <verse number="13" style="v" />He placed garrisons in Edom, and all the Edomites became David's servants. Yahweh gave victory to David wherever he went.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="14" style="v" />David reigned over all Israel, and he administered justice and righteousness to all his people.

  <verse number="15" style="v" />Joab son of Zeruiah was the commander of the army, and Jehoshaphat son of Ahilud was recorder.

  <verse number="16" style="v" />Zadok son of Ahitub and Ahimelech son of Abiathar were priests, and Shavsha was scribe.

  <verse number="17" style="v" />Benaiah son of Jehoiada was over the Cherethites and Pelethites, and David's sons were the king's leading advisors.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />It came about later that Nahash, king of the people of Ammon, died, and that his son became king in his place.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />David said, "I will show kindness to Hanun son of Nahash, because his father showed kindness to me." So David sent messengers to console him concerning his father. David's servants entered the land of the Ammonites and went to Hanun, in order to console him.

  <verse number="3" style="v" />But the Ammonites princes said to Hanun, "Do you think that David is honoring your father because he has sent men to comfort you? Do not his servants come to you to explore and examine the land in order to overthrow it?"

<verse number="4" style="v" />So Hanun seized David's servants, shaved them, cut off their garments to the waist, up to their buttocks, and sent them away.

  <verse number="5" style="v" />When they explained this to David, he sent to meet with them, for the men were deeply ashamed. The king said, "Stay at Jericho until your beards have grown back, and then return."</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="6" style="v" />When the Ammonites saw that they had become a stench to David, Hanun and the Ammonites sent a thousand talents of silver to hire Aramean chariots and horsemen from Naharaim, Maacah, and Zobah.

  <verse number="7" style="v" />They hired them thirty-two thousand chariots with the king of Maacah and his people, who came and encamped before Medeba. The Ammonites gathered themselves together from their cities, and came out for war.

<verse number="8" style="v" />When David heard of it, he sent Joab and his entire army to meet them.

  <verse number="9" style="v" />The people of Ammon came out and lined up for battle at the city gate, while the kings who had come were by themselves in the field.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="10" style="v" />When Joab saw the battle lines facing him both in front and behind, he chose some of Israel's best fighters and arranged them against the Arameans.

  <verse number="11" style="v" />As for the rest of the army, he gave it into the command of Abishai his brother, and he put them into battle lines against the army of Ammon.

<verse number="12" style="v" />Joab said, "If the Arameans are too strong for me, then you, Abishai, must rescue me. But if the army of Ammon is too strong for you, then I will come and rescue you.

  <verse number="13" style="v" />Be strong, and let us show ourselves to be strong for our people and for the cities of our God, for Yahweh will do what is good for his purpose."

<verse number="14" style="v" />So Joab and the soldiers of his army advanced to the battle against the Arameans, who were forced to flee before the army of Israel.

  <verse number="15" style="v" />When the army of Ammon saw that the Arameans had fled, they also fled from Joab's brother Abishai and went back into the city. Then Joab returned from the people of Ammon and went back to Jerusalem.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="16" style="v" />When the Arameans saw that they were being defeated by Israel, they sent for reinforcements from beyond the Euphrates River, with Shophach the commander of Hadadezer's army.

  <verse number="17" style="v" />When David was told this, he gathered all Israel together, crossed the Jordan, and came upon them. He arranged the army for battle  against the Arameans, and they fought him.

<verse number="18" style="v" />The Arameans fled from Israel, and David killed seven thousand Aramean charioteers and forty thousand foot soldiers. He also killed Shophach, the commander of the army.

  <verse number="19" style="v" />When all the kings who were servants of Hadadezer saw that they were defeated by Israel, they made peace with David and served them. So the people of Aram were no longer willing to help the Ammonites.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />It came about in the springtime, at the time when kings normally go to war, that Joab led the army into battle and devastated the land of the Ammonites. He went and besieged Rabbah. David remained in Jerusalem. Joab attacked Rabbah and defeated it.

<verse number="2" style="v" />David took the crown of their king from off his head, and he found that it weighed a talent of gold, and in it were precious stones. The crown was set on David's head, and he brought out the plunder of the city in large quantities.

  <verse number="3" style="v" />He brought out the people who were in the city and forced them to work with saws and iron picks and axes. David required all the cities of the people of Ammon to do this labor. Then David and all the army returned to Jerusalem.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="4" style="v" />It came about after this that there was a battle at Gezer with the Philistines. Sibbecai the Hushathite killed Sippai, one of the descendants of the Rephaim, and the Philistines were subdued.

  <verse number="5" style="v" />It came about again in a battle with the Philistines at Gob, that Elhanan son of Jari the Bethlehemite killed Lahmi brother of Goliath the Gittite, the staff of whose spear was like a weaver's beam.

<verse number="6" style="v" />It came about in another battle at Gath that there was a man of great height who had six fingers on each hand and six toes on each foot. He also was descended from the Rephaim.

  <verse number="7" style="v" />When he mocked the army of Israel, Jehonadab son of Shimea, David's brother, killed him.

  <verse number="8" style="v" />These were descendants of the Rephaim of Gath, and they were killed by the hand of David and by the hand of his soldiers.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />An adversary arose against Israel and incited David to count Israel.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />David said to Joab and to the commanders of the army, "Go, count the people of Israel from Beersheba to Dan and report back to me, that I may know their number."

  <verse number="3" style="v" />Joab said, "May Yahweh make his army a hundred times greater than it is. But my master the king, do they not all serve my master? Why does my master want this? Why bring guilt on Israel?"

<verse number="4" style="v" />But the king's word was final against Joab. So Joab left and went throughout all Israel. Then he came back to Jerusalem.

  <verse number="5" style="v" />Then Joab reported the total of the count of the fighting men to David. There were in Israel 1,100,000 men who drew the sword. Judah alone had 470,000 soldiers.

<verse number="6" style="v" />But Levi and Benjamin were not counted among them, for the king's command had disgusted Joab.

  <verse number="7" style="v" />God was offended by this action, so he attacked Israel.

  <verse number="8" style="v" />David said to God, "I have greatly sinned by doing this. Now take away your servant's guilt, for I have acted very foolishly."</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="9" style="v" />Yahweh told Gad, David's prophet,

  <verse number="10" style="v" />"Go say to David, 'This is what Yahweh says: I am giving you three choices. Choose one of them.'"

<verse number="11" style="v" />So Gad went to David and said to him, "Yahweh says this, 'Choose one of these:

  <verse number="12" style="v" />either three years of famine, three months being pursued by your enemies and being caught by their swords, or else three days of Yahweh's sword, that is, a plague in the land, with the angel of Yahweh destroying throughout all the land of Israel.' Now then, decide what answer I should take to the one who sent me."

<verse number="13" style="v" />Then David said to Gad, "I am in deep trouble. Let me fall into the hand of Yahweh rather than into the hand of man, for his merciful actions are very great."

  <verse number="14" style="v" />So Yahweh sent a plague on Israel, and seventy thousand people died.

  <verse number="15" style="v" />God sent an angel to Jerusalem to destroy it. As he was about to destroy it, Yahweh watched and changed his mind about the harm. He said to the destroying angel, "Enough! Now draw back your hand." At that time the angel of Yahweh was standing at the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.

<verse number="16" style="v" />David looked up and saw the angel of Yahweh standing between earth and heaven, having a drawn sword in his hand raised over Jerusalem. Then David and the elders, clothed in sackcloth, lay facedown on the ground.

  <verse number="17" style="v" />David said to God, "Is it not I that commanded that the army be numbered? I did this wicked thing. But these sheep, what have they done? Yahweh my God! Let your hand strike me and my family, but do not let the plague remain on your people."</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="18" style="v" />So the angel of Yahweh commanded Gad to say to David, that David should go up and build an altar for Yahweh at the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.

  <verse number="19" style="v" />So David went up as Gad instructed him to do in the name of Yahweh.

  <verse number="20" style="v" />While Ornan was threshing wheat, he turned and saw the angel. He and his four sons with him hid themselves.

<verse number="21" style="v" />When David came to Ornan, Ornan looked and saw David. He left the threshing floor and bowed to David with his face to the ground.

  <verse number="22" style="v" />Then David said to Ornan, "Sell me this threshing floor, so I can build an altar for Yahweh. I will pay the full price, so that the plague may be removed from the people."

<verse number="23" style="v" />Ornan said to David, "Take it as your own, my master the king. Do with it what is good in your sight. Look, I will give you oxen for burnt offerings, threshing sledges for wood, and wheat for the grain offering; I will give it all to you."

  <verse number="24" style="v" />King David said to Ornan, "No, I insist on buying it for the full price. I will not take what is yours and offer it as a burnt offering to Yahweh if it costs me nothing."

<verse number="25" style="v" />So David paid six hundred shekels of gold for the place.

  <verse number="26" style="v" />David built an altar for Yahweh there and offered on it burnt offerings and fellowship offerings. He called on Yahweh, who answered him with fire from heaven on the altar for burnt offerings.

  <verse number="27" style="v" />Then Yahweh gave an order to the angel, and the angel put his sword back into its sheath.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="28" style="v" />When David saw that Yahweh had answered him at the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite, he performed the sacrifice there at that same time.

  <verse number="29" style="v" />Now at that time, Yahweh's tabernacle, which Moses had made in the wilderness, and the altar for burnt offerings, were at the high place at Gibeon.

  <verse number="30" style="v" />However, David could not go there to ask for God's direction, because he was afraid of the sword of the angel of Yahweh.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />Then David said, "This is where the house of Yahweh God will be, with the altar for the burnt offerings of Israel."</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="2" style="v" />So David ordered his servants to gather together the foreigners living in the land of Israel. He assigned them to be stonecutters, to cut stone blocks, in order to build God's house.

<verse number="3" style="v" />David supplied a large amount of iron for the nails for the doors to go in the gateways, and for braces. He also supplied more bronze than could be weighed,

  <verse number="4" style="v" />and more cedar trees than could be counted. (The Sidonians and the Tyrians brought too many cedar logs to David to count.)

  <verse number="5" style="v" />David said, "My son Solomon is young and inexperienced, and the house that is to be built for Yahweh must be especially magnificent, so that it will be famous and glorious in all other lands. So I will prepare for its building." So David made extensive preparations before his death.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="6" style="v" />Then he called for Solomon his son and commanded him to build a house for Yahweh, the God of Israel.

  <verse number="7" style="v" />David said to Solomon, "My son, it was my intention to build a house myself, for the name of Yahweh my God.

  <verse number="8" style="v" />But Yahweh came to me and said, 'You have shed much blood and have fought many battles. You will not build a house for my name, because you have shed much blood on the earth in my sight.

<verse number="9" style="v" />However, you will have a son who will be a peaceful man. I will give him rest from all his enemies on every side. For his name will be Solomon, and I will give peace and quiet to Israel in his days.

  <verse number="10" style="v" />He will build a house for my name. He will be my son, and I will be his father. I will establish the throne of his kingdom over Israel forever.'

<verse number="11" style="v" />Now, my son, may Yahweh be with you and enable you to succeed. May you build the house of Yahweh your God, as he said you would.

  <verse number="12" style="v" />Only may Yahweh give you insight and understanding, so that you may obey the law of Yahweh your God, when he places you in charge over Israel.

  <verse number="13" style="v" />Then you will succeed, if you carefully obey the statutes and the decrees that Yahweh gave to Moses concerning Israel. Be strong and courageous. Do not fear or be discouraged.

<verse number="14" style="v" />Now, see, at great effort I have prepared for Yahweh's house 100,000 talents of gold, one million talents of silver, and bronze and iron in large quantities. I have also provided timber and stone. You must add more to all this.

<verse number="15" style="v" />You have many workmen with you: stonecutters, masons, carpenters, and skillful craftsmen without number of every kind,

  <verse number="16" style="v" />who can work with gold, silver, bronze, and iron. So begin to work, and may Yahweh be with you."</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="17" style="v" />David also ordered all the leaders of Israel to help Solomon his son, saying,

  <verse number="18" style="v" />"Yahweh your God is with you and has given you peace on every side. He has given the region's inhabitants into my hand. The region is subdued before Yahweh and his people.

  <verse number="19" style="v" />Now seek Yahweh your God with all your heart and your soul. Get up and build the holy place of Yahweh God. Then you can bring the ark of the covenant of Yahweh and the things that belong to God into the house built for Yahweh's name."</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />When David was old and near the end of his life, he made Solomon his son king over Israel.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />He gathered together all the leaders of Israel, with the priests and Levites.

  <verse number="3" style="v" />The Levites who were thirty years old and older were counted. They numbered thirty-eight thousand.

<verse number="4" style="v" />"Of these, twenty-four thousand were to oversee the work of Yahweh's house, and six thousand were officers and judges.

  <verse number="5" style="v" />Four thousand were gatekeepers, and four thousand were to praise Yahweh with the instruments that I made to give praise," David said.

  <verse number="6" style="v" />He divided them into groups that corresponded to Levi's sons: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="7" style="v" />From the clans descended from Gershon, there were Ladan and Shimei.

  <verse number="8" style="v" />There were three of Ladan's sons: Jehiel the leader, Zetham, and Joel.

  <verse number="9" style="v" />There were three of Shimei's sons: Shelomoth, Haziel, and Haran. These were the leaders of the clans of Ladan.

<verse number="10" style="v" />There were four of Shimei's sons: Jahath, Ziza, Jeush, and Beriah.

  <verse number="11" style="v" />Jahath was the oldest, and Ziza the second, but Jeush and Beriah did not have many sons, so they were considered as one clan with the same duties.

<verse number="12" style="v" />There were four of Kohath's sons: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.

  <verse number="13" style="v" />These were Amram's sons: Aaron and Moses. Aaron was chosen to set apart the most holy things, that he and his descendants would offer incense before Yahweh, to serve him and to give blessings in his name forever.

  <verse number="14" style="v" />But as for Moses the man of God, his sons were considered to be Levites.

<verse number="15" style="v" />Moses' sons were Gershom and Eliezer.

  <verse number="16" style="v" />Gershom's descendant was Shebuel the oldest.

  <verse number="17" style="v" />Eliezer's descendant was Rehabiah. Eliezer had no other sons, but Rehabiah had many descendants.

  <verse number="18" style="v" />Izhar's son was Shelomith the leader.

<verse number="19" style="v" />Hebron's descendants were Jeriah, the oldest, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, and Jekameam the fourth.

  <verse number="20" style="v" />Uzziel's sons were Micah the oldest, and Isshiah the second.

<verse number="21" style="v" />Merari's sons were Mahli and Mushi. Mahli's sons were Eleazar and Kish.

  <verse number="22" style="v" />Eleazar died without having any sons. He had only daughters. The sons of Kish married them.

  <verse number="23" style="v" />Mushi's three sons were Mahli, Eder, and Jeremoth.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="24" style="v" />These were Levi's descendants corresponding to their clans. They were the leaders, counted and listed by name, of the clans that did the work in the service of Yahweh's house, from twenty years old and upward.

  <verse number="25" style="v" />For David said, "Yahweh, the God of Israel, has given rest to his people. He makes his home in Jerusalem forever.

  <verse number="26" style="v" />The Levites will no longer need to carry the tabernacle and all the equipment used in its service."

<verse number="27" style="v" />For by David's last words the Levites were counted, from twenty years old and upward.

  <verse number="28" style="v" />Their duty was to assist Aaron's descendants in the service of Yahweh's house. They were to care for the courtyards, the rooms, the ceremonial purification of all the things that belong to Yahweh, and other work in the service of God's house.

  <verse number="29" style="v" />They also took care of the bread of the presence, the fine flour for grain offerings, the unleavened wafers, the baked offerings, the offerings mixed with oil, and all the measuring of the amounts and sizes of things.

<verse number="30" style="v" />They also stood every morning to thank and praise Yahweh. They also did this in the evening

  <verse number="31" style="v" />and whenever burnt offerings were offered to Yahweh, on the Sabbath and at the new moon festivals and feast days. A fixed number, assigned by decree, always had to be present before Yahweh.
<verse number="32" style="v" />They were in charge of the tent of meeting, the holy place, and helped their fellow descendants of Aaron in the service of Yahweh's house.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />The work groups based on Aaron's descendants were these: Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />Nadab and Abihu died before their father died. They had no children, so Eleazar and Ithamar served as priests.

  <verse number="3" style="v" />David, together with Zadok, a descendant of Eleazar, and Ahimelech, a descendant of Ithamar, divided them into groups for their work as priests.

<verse number="4" style="v" />There were more leading men among Eleazar's descendants than among Ithamar's descendants, so they divided Eleazar's descendants into sixteen groups. They did this by heads of clans and by Ithamar's descendants. These divisions were eight in number, corresponding to their clans.

  <verse number="5" style="v" />They divided them impartially by lot, for there were holy officials and officials of God, from both Eleazar's descendants and Ithamar's descendants.

<verse number="6" style="v" />Shemaiah son of Nethanel the scribe, a Levite, wrote down their names in the presence of the king, the officials, Zadok the priest, Ahimelech son of Abiathar, and the leaders of the priestly and Levite families. One clan was drawn by lot from Eleazar's descendants, and then the next would be drawn from Ithamar's descendants.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="7" style="v" />The first lot went to Jehoiarib, the second to Jedaiah,

  <verse number="8" style="v" />the third to Harim, the fourth to Seorim,

  <verse number="9" style="v" />the fifth to Malchijah, the sixth to Mijamin,

  <verse number="10" style="v" />the seventh to Hakkoz, the eighth to Abijah,

<verse number="11" style="v" />the ninth to Jeshua, the tenth to Shecaniah,

  <verse number="12" style="v" />the eleventh to Eliashib, the twelfth to Jakim,

  <verse number="13" style="v" />the thirteenth to Huppah, the fourteenth to Jeshebeab,

  <verse number="14" style="v" />the fifteenth to Bilgah, the sixteenth to Immer,

<verse number="15" style="v" />the seventeenth to Hezir, the eighteenth to Happizzez,

  <verse number="16" style="v" />the nineteenth to Pethahiah, the twentieth to Jehezkel,

  <verse number="17" style="v" />the twenty-first to Jachin, the twenty-second to Gamul,

  <verse number="18" style="v" />the twenty-third to Delaiah, and the twenty-fourth to Maaziah.

<verse number="19" style="v" />This was the order of their service, when they came into Yahweh's house, following the procedure given to them by Aaron their ancestor, as Yahweh, the God of Israel, had instructed him.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="20" style="v" />These were the rest of the Levi: of the sons of Amram, Shebuel; of the sons of Shebael, Jehdeiah.

  <verse number="21" style="v" />The sons of Rehabiah: of the sons of Rehabiah, Isshiah the leader.

  <verse number="22" style="v" />Of the Izarites, Shelomoth; of the sons of Shelomoth, Jahath.

<verse number="23" style="v" />The sons of Hebron: Jeriah the leader, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, and Jekameam thefourth.

  <verse number="24" style="v" />The sons of Uzziel's descendants included Micah. Micah's descendants included Shamir.

  <verse number="25" style="v" />Micah's brother was Isshiah. Isshiah's sons included Zechariah.

<verse number="26" style="v" />The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. The son of Jaaziah, Beno.

  <verse number="27" style="v" />The sons of Merari: Jaaziah, Beno, Shoham, Zaccur, and Ibri.

  <verse number="28" style="v" />The sons of Mahli: Eleazar, who had no sons.

<verse number="29" style="v" />The sons of Kish, the sons of Kish: Jerahmeel

  <verse number="30" style="v" />The sons of Mushi: Mahli, Eder, and Jerimoth. These were the Levites, listed by their families.

  <verse number="31" style="v" />These men who were the head of each father's house and each of their younger brothers, cast lots in the presence of King David, and Zadok and Ahimelech, along with the leaders of the families of the priests and Levites. They threw lots just as Aaron's descendants had done.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />David and the leaders of the tabernacle work selected for the work some of the sons of Asaph, Heman, and Jeduthun. These men prophesied with harps, stringed instruments, and cymbals. Here is a list of the men who did this work:

  <verse number="2" style="v" />From the sons of Asaph: Zaccur, Joseph, Nethaniah, and Asharelah, the sons of Asaph, under the direction of Asaph, who prophesied under the king's supervision.

  <verse number="3" style="v" />From the sons of Jeduthun: Gedaliah, Zeri, Jeshaiah, Shimei, Hashabiah, and Mattithiah, six in all, under the direction of their father Jeduthun, who played the harp for giving thanks and praising Yahweh.

<verse number="4" style="v" />From the sons of Heman: Bukkiah, Mattaniah, Uzziel, Shebuel, and Jerimoth, Hananiah, Hanani, Eliathah, Giddalti, Romamti Ezer, Joshbekashah, Mallothi, Hothir, and Mahazioth.

  <verse number="5" style="v" />All these were the sons of Heman the king's prophet. God gave Heman fourteen sons and three daughters in order to honor him.

<verse number="6" style="v" />All these were under the direction of their fathers. They were musicians in Yahweh's house, with cymbals and stringed instruments as they served in God's house. Asaph, Jeduthun, and Heman were under the king's supervision.

  <verse number="7" style="v" />They and their brothers who were skilled and trained to make music to Yahweh numbered 288.

  <verse number="8" style="v" />They threw lots for their duties, all alike, the same for the young as well as the old, the teacher as well as the student.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="9" style="v" />Now regarding Asaph's sons: the first lot fell to Joseph's family; the second fell to Gedaliah's family, twelve persons in number;

  <verse number="10" style="v" />the third fell to Zaccur, his sons and his relatives, twelve persons in number;

  <verse number="11" style="v" />the fourth fell to Izri, his sons and his relatives, twelve persons in number;

  <verse number="12" style="v" />the fifth fell to Nethaniah, his sons and his relatives, twelve persons in number;

<verse number="13" style="v" />the sixth fell to Bukkiah, his sons and his relatives, twelve persons in number;

  <verse number="14" style="v" />the seventh fell to Jesharelah, his sons and his relatives, twelve persons in number;

  <verse number="15" style="v" />the eighth fell to Jeshaiah, his sons and his relatives, twelve persons in number;

  <verse number="16" style="v" />the ninth fell to Mattaniah, his sons and his relatives, twelve persons in number;

<verse number="17" style="v" />the tenth fell to Shimei, his sons and his relatives, twelve persons in number;

  <verse number="18" style="v" />the eleventh fell to Azarel, his sons and his relatives, twelve persons in number;

  <verse number="19" style="v" />the twelfth fell to Hashabiah, his sons and his relatives, twelve persons in number;

  <verse number="20" style="v" />the thirteenth fell to Shubael, his sons and his relatives, twelve persons in number;

<verse number="21" style="v" />the fourteenth fell to Mattithiah, his sons and his relatives, twelve persons in number;

  <verse number="22" style="v" />the fifteenth fell to Jeremoth, his sons and his relatives, twelve persons in number;

  <verse number="23" style="v" />the sixteenth fell to Hananiah, his sons and his relatives, twelve persons in number;

  <verse number="24" style="v" />the seventeenth fell to Joshbekashah, his sons and his relatives, twelve persons in number;

<verse number="25" style="v" />the eighteenth fell to Hanani, his sons and his relatives, twelve persons in number;

  <verse number="26" style="v" />the nineteenth fell to Mallothi, his sons and his relatives, twelve persons in number;

  <verse number="27" style="v" />the twentieth fell to Eliathah, his sons and his relatives, twelve persons in number;

  <verse number="28" style="v" />the twenty-first fell to Hothir, his sons and his relatives, twelve persons in number;

<verse number="29" style="v" />the twenty-second fell to Giddalti, his sons and his relatives, twelve persons in number;

  <verse number="30" style="v" />the twenty-third fell to Mahazioth, his sons and his relatives, twelve persons in number;

  <verse number="31" style="v" />the twenty-fourth fell to Romamti Ezer, his sons and his relatives, twelve persons in number.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />Here were the divisions of the gatekeepers: From the Korahites, Meshelemiah son of Kore, a descendant of Asaph.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />Meshelemiah had sons: Zechariah the firstborn, Jediael the second, Zebadiah the third, Jathniel the fourth,

  <verse number="3" style="v" />Elam the fifth, Jehohanan the sixth, Eliehoenai the seventh.

<verse number="4" style="v" />Obed Edom had sons: Shemaiah the firstborn, Jehozabad the second, Joah the third, and Sacar the fourth, and Nethanel the fifth,

  <verse number="5" style="v" />Ammiel the sixth, Issachar the seventh, Peullethai the eighth, for God had blessed Obed Edom.

  <verse number="6" style="v" />To Shemaiah his son were born sons who ruled over their families; they were men with many abilities.

<verse number="7" style="v" />The sons of Shemaiah were Othni, Rephael, Obed, and Elzabad. His relatives Elihu and Semachiah were also men with many abilities.

  <verse number="8" style="v" />All these were descendants of Obed Edom. They and their sons and relatives were men capable of doing their duties in the tabernacle service. There were sixty-two of them related to Obed Edom.

  <verse number="9" style="v" />Meshelemiah had sons and relatives, capable men, eighteen in all.

<verse number="10" style="v" />Hosah, a descendant of Merari, had sons: Shimri the leader (although he was not the firstborn, his father made him leader),

  <verse number="11" style="v" />Hilkiah the second, Tebaliah the third, Zechariah the fourth. All of Hosah's sons and kinsmen were thirteen in number.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="12" style="v" />These divisions of the gatekeepers, corresponding to their leaders, had responsibilities, like their relatives, to serve in Yahweh's house.

  <verse number="13" style="v" />They threw lots, both young and old, corresponding to their families, for every gate.

  <verse number="14" style="v" />When the lot was thrown for the east gate, it fell to Shelemiah. They then threw lots for Zechariah his son, a prudent advisor, and his lot came out for the north gate.

<verse number="15" style="v" />To Obed Edom was assigned the south gate, and his sons were assigned the storehouses.

  <verse number="16" style="v" />Shuppim and Hosah were assigned the west gate along with the gate of Shallecheth, on the upper road. Watches were established for each family.

<verse number="17" style="v" />On the east were six Levites, on the north four a day, on the south four a day, and at the storehouses two pairs.

  <verse number="18" style="v" />At the court to the west there were four posted, four at the road, and two at the court.

  <verse number="19" style="v" />These were the gatekeepers' divisions. They were filled with descendants of Korah and Merari.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="20" style="v" />Among the Levites, Ahijah was in charge of the treasures of God's house, and of the treasures of the things that belong to Yahweh.

  <verse number="21" style="v" />The descendants of Ladan, descended from Gershon through him and who were leaders of the families of Ladan the Gershonite, were Jehieli and his sons,

  <verse number="22" style="v" />Zetham, and Joel his brother, who oversaw the storehouses of Yahweh's house.

<verse number="23" style="v" />There were also guards drawn from the clans of Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.

  <verse number="24" style="v" />Shebuel son of Gershom son of Moses, was supervisor over the storehouses.

  <verse number="25" style="v" />His relatives from the clan of Eliezer were his son Rehabiah, Rehabiah's son Jeshaiah, Jeshaiah's son Joram, Joram's son Zichri, and Zichri's son Shelomoth.

<verse number="26" style="v" />Shelomoth and his relatives were over all the storehouses holding the things that belong to Yahweh, that David the king, the family leaders, commanders over thousands and hundreds, and the army commanders had set apart.

  <verse number="27" style="v" />They set apart the plunder won in battles for the upkeep of the house of Yahweh.

  <verse number="28" style="v" />They were also in charge of everything that was set apart to Yahweh by Samuel the prophet, Saul son of Kish, Abner son of Ner, and Joab son of Zeruiah. Everything that was set apart to Yahweh was under the guard of Shelomoth and his relatives.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="29" style="v" />Of Izhar's descendants, Kenaniah and his sons were in charge of the civil affairs of Israel. They were officers and judges.

  <verse number="30" style="v" />Of Hebron's descendants, Hashabiah and his brothers, 1,700 capable men, were in charge of Yahweh's work and the king's work. They were on the west side of the Jordan.

<verse number="31" style="v" />From Hebron's descendants, Jerijah was the leader of his descendants, counted from the lists of their families. In the fortieth year of the reign of David they examined the records and found among them men of ability in Jazer of Gilead.

  <verse number="32" style="v" />Jerijah had 2,700 relatives, who were capable family leaders. David made them overseers over the tribes of Reuben and Gad, and the half tribe of Manasseh, for every matter pertaining to God, and for the king's affairs.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />This is the list of the Israelite family leaders, commanders of thousands and hundreds, as well as army officers who served the king in various ways. Each military division served month by month throughout the year. Each division had twenty-four thousand men

  <verse number="2" style="v" />Over the division for the first month was Jashobeam son of Zabdiel. In his division were twenty-four thousand men.

  <verse number="3" style="v" />He was among the descendants of Perez and in charge of all the army officers for the first month.

<verse number="4" style="v" />Over the division for the second month was Dodai, from the clan descended from Ahoah. Mikloth was second in rank. In his division were twenty-four thousand men.

  <verse number="5" style="v" />The commander of the army for the third month was Benaiah son of Jehoiada, a priest and leader. In his division were twenty-four thousand men.

  <verse number="6" style="v" />This is the Benaiah who was the leader of the thirty, and over the thirty. Ammizabad his son was in his division.

<verse number="7" style="v" />The commander for the fourth month was Asahel brother of Joab. Zebadiah his son became commander after him. In his division were twenty-four thousand men.

  <verse number="8" style="v" />The commander for the fifth month was Shamhuth, a descendant of Izrah. In his division were twenty-four thousand men.

  <verse number="9" style="v" />The commander for the sixth month was Ira son of Ikkesh, from Tekoa. In his division were twenty-four thousand men.

<verse number="10" style="v" />The commander for the seventh month was Helez the Pelonite, from the people of Ephraim. In his division were twenty-four thousand men.

  <verse number="11" style="v" />The commander for the eighth month was Sibbecai the Hushathite, from the clan descended from Zerah. In his division were twenty-four thousand men.

  <verse number="12" style="v" />The commander for the ninth month was Abi Ezer the Anathothite, from the tribe of Benjamin. In his division were twenty-four thousand men.

<verse number="13" style="v" />The commander for the tenth month was Maharai from the city of Netophah, from the clan descended from Zerah. In his division were twenty-four thousand men.

  <verse number="14" style="v" />The commander for the eleventh month was Benaiah from the city of Pirathon, from the tribe of Ephraim. In his division were twenty-four thousand men.

  <verse number="15" style="v" />The commander for the twelfth month was Heldai from the city of Netophah, from the clan descended from Othniel. In his division were twenty-four thousand men.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="16" style="v" />These were the leaders of the tribes of Israel: For the tribe of Reuben, Eliezer son of Zichri was the leader. For the tribe of Simeon, Shephatiah son of Maacah was the leader.

  <verse number="17" style="v" />For the tribe of Levi, Hashabiah son of Kemuel was the leader, and Zadok led Aaron's descendants.

  <verse number="18" style="v" />For the tribe of Judah, Elihu, one of David's brothers, was the leader. For the tribe of Issachar, Omri son of Michael was the leader.

<verse number="19" style="v" />For the tribe of Zebulun, Ishmaiah son of Obadiah was the leader. For the tribe of Naphtali, Jeremoth son of Azriel was the leader.

  <verse number="20" style="v" />For the tribe of Ephraim, Hoshea son of Azaziah was the leader. For the half tribe of Manasseh, Joel son of Pedaiah was the leader.

  <verse number="21" style="v" />For the half tribe of Manasseh in Gilead, Iddo son of Zechariah was the leader. For the tribe of Benjamin, Jaasiel son of Abner was the leader.

  <verse number="22" style="v" />For the tribe of Dan, Azarel son of Jeroham was the leader. These were the leaders of the tribes of Israel.

<verse number="23" style="v" />David did not count those twenty years old or younger, because Yahweh had promised to increase Israel like the stars of heaven.

  <verse number="24" style="v" />Joab son of Zeruiah began to count the men, but did not finish. Wrath fell on Israel for this. This number was not written down in the Chronicles of King David.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="25" style="v" />Azmaveth son of Adiel was in charge of the king's treasuries. Jonathan son of Uzziah was over the storehouses in the fields, in the cities, and in the villages, and in the fortified towers.

  <verse number="26" style="v" />Ezri son of Chelub was over the farmers, those who plowed the land.

  <verse number="27" style="v" />Shimei from Ramah was over the vineyards, and Zabdi from Shepham was over the grapes and the wine cellars.

<verse number="28" style="v" />Over the olive trees and the sycamore trees that were in the lowlands was Baal Hanan from Geder, and over the storehouses of oil was Joash.

  <verse number="29" style="v" />Over the herds that were pastured in Sharon was Shitrai from Sharon, and over the herds that were in the valleys was Shaphat son of Adlai.

<verse number="30" style="v" />Over the camels was Obil the Ishmaelite, and over the female donkeys was Jehdeiah from Meronoth. Over the flocks was Jaziz the Hagrite.

  <verse number="31" style="v" />All these were overseers of the property of King David.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="32" style="v" />Jonathan, David's uncle, was an advisor, since he was a wise man and a scribe. Jehiel son of Hachmoni cared for the king's sons.

  <verse number="33" style="v" />Ahithophel was the king's advisor, and Hushai from the Archite people was the king's private advisor.

  <verse number="34" style="v" />Ahithophel's position was taken by Jehoiada son of Benaiah, and by Abiathar. Joab was commander of the king's army.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />David assembled all the officials of Israel at Jerusalem: the officials of the tribes, the officers of the divisions that served the king in their scheduled work, the commanders of thousands and of hundreds, the managers over all the property and possessions of the king and of his sons, and the officers and fighting men, including the most skilled of them.

<verse number="2" style="v" />Then David the king rose to his feet and said, "Listen to me, my brothers and my people. It was my intention to build a temple for the ark of the covenant of Yahweh; a footstool for our God, and I have made preparations to build it.

  <verse number="3" style="v" />But God said to me, 'You will not build a temple for my name, because you are a man of war and have shed blood.'

<verse number="4" style="v" />Yet Yahweh, the God of Israel, chose me from all my father's family to be king over Israel forever. He has chosen the tribe of Judah as leader. In the tribe of Judah, and in my father's household, out of all my father's sons, he chose me to be king over all Israel.

  <verse number="5" style="v" />From the many sons whom Yahweh has given me, he chose Solomon, my son, to sit on the throne of the kingdom of Yahweh, over Israel.

<verse number="6" style="v" />He said to me, 'Solomon your son will build my house and my courtyards, for I have chosen him to be my son, and I will be his father.

  <verse number="7" style="v" />I will establish his kingdom forever, if he remains committed to obey my commandments and decrees, as you are this day.'

<verse number="8" style="v" />Now then, in the sight of all Israel, this assembly for Yahweh, and in the presence of our God, all of you must keep and try to carry outall the commandments of Yahweh your God. Do this so that you may possess this good land and leave it as an inheritance to your children after you forever.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="9" style="v" />As for you, Solomon my son, obey the God of your father, and serve him with your whole heart and a willing spirit. Do this because Yahweh searches all hearts and understands every motivation of everyone's thoughts. If you seek him, he will be found by you, but if you abandon him, he will reject you permanently.

  <verse number="10" style="v" />Realize that Yahweh has chosen you to build this temple as his sanctuary. Be strong and do it."</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="11" style="v" />Then David gave to Solomon his son the plans for the temple portico, the temple buildings, the storerooms, the upper rooms, the inner rooms, and the room with the atonement lid.

  <verse number="12" style="v" />He gave him the plans he had drawn for the courtyards of Yahweh's house, all the surrounding rooms, the storerooms in God's house, and the treasuries for the things that belong to Yahweh.

<verse number="13" style="v" />He gave him regulations for the divisions of the priests and Levites, for the assigned responsibilities for the service of the house of Yahweh, and for all the objects for the service in Yahweh's house.

  <verse number="14" style="v" />He gave him the weight of all the gold vessels for every kind of service and of all the silver vessels, for all the objects for every kind of service.

  <verse number="15" style="v" />These details were given by weight, including the details for the gold lampstands and gold lamps, the details by weight for every lampstand, for the lamps, for the silver lampstands, and details for the proper use of every lampstand.

<verse number="16" style="v" />He gave the weight of the gold for the tables of the bread of the presence, for every table, and the weight of the silver for the silver tables.

  <verse number="17" style="v" />He gave the weight of pure gold for the meat forks, basins, and cups. He gave the weight for each of the gold bowls, and the weight of each of the silver bowls.

<verse number="18" style="v" />He gave the weight of refined gold for the incense altar, and of the gold for the design of the cherubim that spread out their wings and covered the ark of the covenant of Yahweh.

  <verse number="19" style="v" />David said, "I have put all this in writing as Yahweh directed me and gave me to understand regarding the design."</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="20" style="v" />David said to Solomon his son, "Be strong and brave. Do the work. Do not be afraid or anxious, for Yahweh God, my God, is with you. He will not leave you nor abandon you until all the work for the service of Yahweh's temple is finished.

  <verse number="21" style="v" />See, here are the divisions of the priests and Levites for all the service in God's temple. They will be with you, together with all willing and skillful men, to assist you in the work and to perform the service. The officials and all the people are ready to follow your commands."</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />King David said to the whole assembly, "Solomon my son, whom alone God has chosen, is still young and inexperienced, and the task is great. For the temple is not for people but for Yahweh God.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />So I have done my best to provide for the temple of my God. I am giving gold for the things to be made of gold, silver for the things to be made of silver, bronze for the things to be made of bronze, iron for the things to be made of iron, and wood for the things to be made of wood. I am also giving onyx stones, stones to be set, stones for inlaid work of various colors—all kinds of precious stones—and marble stone in abundance.

<verse number="3" style="v" />Now, because of my delight in the house of my God, I am giving my personal treasure of gold and silver for it. I am doing this in addition to all that I have prepared for this holy temple:

  <verse number="4" style="v" />three thousand talents of gold from Ophir, and seven thousand talents of refined silver, in order to overlay the walls of the buildings.

  <verse number="5" style="v" />I am donating gold for the things to be made of gold, and silver for the things to be made of silver, and things for all kinds of work to be done by craftsmen. Who else wants to make a contribution to Yahweh today and give himself to him?"</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="6" style="v" />Then freewill offerings were made by the leaders of their ancestors' families, the leaders of the tribes of Israel, the commanders of thousands and hundreds, and by the officials over the king's work.

  <verse number="7" style="v" />They gave for the service of God's house five thousand talents and ten thousand darics of gold, ten thousand talents of silver, eighteen thousand talents of silver, and 100,000 talents of iron.

<verse number="8" style="v" />Those who had precious stones gave them to the treasury of Yahweh's house, under the supervision of Jehiel, a descendant of Gershon.

  <verse number="9" style="v" />The people rejoiced because of these freewilll offerings, because they had contributed wholeheartedly to Yahweh. King David also rejoiced greatly.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="10" style="v" />David blessed Yahweh in front of all the assembly. He said, "May you be praised, Yahweh, God of Israel our ancestor, forever and ever.

  <verse number="11" style="v" />Yours, Yahweh, is the greatness, the power, the glory, the victory, and the majesty. For all that is in the heavens and on the earth is yours. Yours is the kingdom, Yahweh, and you are exalted as ruler over all.

<verse number="12" style="v" />Both riches and honor come from you, and you rule over all people. In your hand is power and might. You possess the strength and might to make people great and to give strength to anyone.

  <verse number="13" style="v" />Now then, our God, we thank you and praise your glorious name.

<verse number="14" style="v" />But who am I, and who are my people, that we should be able to offer so willingly these things? Indeed, all things come from you, and we have simply given back to you what is yours.

  <verse number="15" style="v" />For we are strangers and travelers before you, as all our ancestors were. Our days on the earth are like a shadow, and there is no hope of remaining on earth.

<verse number="16" style="v" />Yahweh our God, all this wealth that we have collected in order to build a temple to honor your holy name—it comes from you and belongs to you.

  <verse number="17" style="v" />I know also, my God, that you examine the heart and have pleasure in uprightness. As for me, in the uprightness of my heart I have willingly offered all these things, and now I look with joy as your people who are present here willingly offer gifts to you.

<verse number="18" style="v" />Yahweh, the God of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel—our ancestors—keep this forever in the thoughts of the minds of your people. Direct their hearts toward you.

  <verse number="19" style="v" />Give to Solomon my son a wholehearted desire to keep your commandments, your covenant decrees, and your statutes, and to carry out all these plans to build the palace for which I have made provision."</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="20" style="v" />David said to all the assembly, "Now bless Yahweh your God." All the assembly blessed Yahweh, the God of their ancestors, bowed their heads and worshiped Yahweh and prostrated themselves before the king.

  <verse number="21" style="v" />On the next day, they made sacrifices to Yahweh and offered burnt offerings to him. They offered a thousand bulls, a thousand rams, and a thousand lambs, with their drink offerings and sacrifices in abundance for all Israel.

<verse number="22" style="v" />On that day, they ate and drank before Yahweh with great celebration.</para>

<para style="p">They made Solomon, David's son, king a second time, and anointed him with Yahweh's authority to be ruler. They also anointed Zadok to be priest.

  <verse number="23" style="v" />Then Solomon sat on Yahweh's throne as king instead of David his father. He prospered, and all Israel obeyed him.

<verse number="24" style="v" />All the leaders, soldiers, and King David's sons gave allegiance to King Solomon.

  <verse number="25" style="v" />Yahweh greatly honored Solomon before all Israel and bestowed on him greater power than he had ever given to any king before him in Israel.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="26" style="v" />David son of Jesse reigned over all Israel.

  <verse number="27" style="v" />David had been king of Israel for forty years. He ruled for seven years in Hebron and for thirty-three years in Jerusalem.

  <verse number="28" style="v" />He died at a good old age, after enjoying a long life, wealth and honor. Solomon his son succeeded him.

<verse number="29" style="v" />King David's accomplishments are written in the history of Samuel the prophet, in the history of Nathan the prophet, and in the history of Gad the prophet.

  <verse number="30" style="v" />Recorded there are the deeds of his rule, his accomplishments and the events that affected him, Israel, and all the kingdoms of the other lands.</para>
